enemy_1113_empace_2.ability: Uses ranged attacks when not blocked; gains greatly increased ATK when HP drops under half.

enemy_1114_rgrdmn.name: Sarkaz Centurion Host
enemy_1114_rgrdmn.description: A Sarkaz mercenary unwittingly converted into one of Mephisto's Herd, able to damage multiple targets at once and drain vitality from its victims. Prevents others from entering the Sarcophagus - do not push too far in, and you may yet avoid their wrath.
enemy_1114_rgrdmn.ability: Attacks 3 targets at once; Restores a certain amount of HP after each attack based upon damage dealt.

enemy_1114_rgrdmn_2.name: Sarkaz Centurion Nidus Guard
enemy_1114_rgrdmn_2.description: A Sarkaz mercenary leader unwittingly converted into one of Mephisto's Herd, able to damage multiple targets at once and drain vitality from its victims. More ferociously prevents others from entering the Sarcophagus.
enemy_1114_rgrdmn_2.ability: Attacks 3 targets at once; Restores a certain amount of HP after each attack based upon damage dealt.

enemy_1115_embald.name: 'Emperor's Blade'
enemy_1115_embald.description: A manifestation of a certain will in Ursus. The most terrifying military force in the entirety of Ursus, they are widely-known throughout the world only as horrifying spectres of legend and yore. A single one is enough to slaughter entire squads. Defeat has never been a possibility.
enemy_1115_embald.ability: Unable to attack, and does not deduct Life Points upon escaping; Permanently applies [Weaken] to Talulah, the Fighter (Greatly reduces DEF and RES).

enemy_3001_upeopl.name: Ursus Civilian
enemy_3001_upeopl.description: An ordinary Ursus citizen caught in the crossfire. A part of the cruelty and suffering of this world.
enemy_3001_upeopl.ability: Does not deplete Life Points when spared, but will instead deduct 1 Life Point upon dying; Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter.

enemy_3002_ftrtal.name: Talulah, the Fighter
enemy_3002_ftrtal.description: The Infected warrior, Talulah. She will never look back.
enemy_3002_ftrtal.ability: Does not deduct Life Points when entering the enemy Incursion Point, but will instead deduct 1 Life Point upon destruction; Applies [Burning Breath] to an enemy within attack range (Deals increasing True damage each second, but can be <$ba.buffres>resisted</>); Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter.

enemy_1116_liprr.name: Ordinary Prisoner
enemy_1116_liprr.description: A commonly seen prisoner of Mansfield State Prison. Even so, don't let your guard down or he'll slip past you.
enemy_1116_liprr.ability: Starts imprisoned. When imprisoned, ASPD is reduced. Freed after a few attacks. After being freed, gains increased ATK at the same time

enemy_1116_liprr_2.name: Seasoned Prisoner
enemy_1116_liprr_2.description: An inmate deeply familiar with the laws of survival of Mansfield State Prison. Will utilize his accumulated experience to outsmart you and is difficult to deal with.
enemy_1116_liprr_2.ability: Starts imprisoned. When imprisoned, ASPD is reduced. Freed after a few attacks. After being freed, gains increased ATK at the same time

enemy_1117_liiprr.name: Sniper Prisoner
enemy_1117_liiprr.description: An inmate who cobbled together a ranged weapon to avoid getting into brawls. Knows a little about Originium Arts and can strengthen his 'arrows'.
enemy_1117_liiprr.ability: Starts imprisoned. When imprisoned, ASPD is reduced. Freed after a few attacks. After being freed, gains increased ATK while attacks instead deal Arts damage; prioritizes attacking Imprisonment Devices

enemy_1117_liiprr_2.name: Elite Sniper Prisoner
enemy_1117_liiprr_2.description: An inmate experienced at using handmade ranged weapons. Though far from a master in Originium Arts, his arrows are already extremely dangerous.
enemy_1117_liiprr_2.ability: Starts imprisoned. When imprisoned, ASPD is reduced. Freed after a few attacks. After being freed, gains increased ATK while attacks instead deal Arts damage; prioritizes attacking Imprisonment Devices

enemy_1118_lidbox.name: Pugilist Prisoner
enemy_1118_lidbox.description: An inmate who puts his trust in his fists. ——In reality, the metal chains on his wrists are doing most of the work.
enemy_1118_lidbox.ability: Starts imprisoned. When imprisoned, ASPD is reduced. Freed after a few attacks. After being freed, gains increased ATK while attacks ignore a certain portion of the target's DEF

enemy_1118_lidbox_2.name: Elite Pugilist Prisoner
enemy_1118_lidbox_2.description: An inmate who wholeheartedly trusts in his fists. Do not underestimate this inmate who is able to utilize both fist and chain in harmony now.
enemy_1118_lidbox_2.ability: Starts imprisoned. When imprisoned, ASPD is reduced. Freed after a few attacks. After being freed, gains increased ATK while attacks ignore a certain portion of the target's DEF

enemy_1119_vofsd.name: Strongman Prisoner
enemy_1119_vofsd.description: An inmate with great strength. The weapons in his hands seem to have been acquired from ransacking a storage room. During a melee, will often rush to the frontline and inflict great damage.
enemy_1119_vofsd.ability: Starts imprisoned. When imprisoned, ASPD is reduced. Freed after a few attacks. After being freed, gains increased ATK, increased RES, and naturally regenerates HP over time

enemy_1119_vofsd_2.name: Herculean Prisoner
enemy_1119_vofsd_2.description: An inmate with immense strength. The weapons in his hands seem to have been acquired from ransacking a storage room. During a melee, will often rush to the frontline and inflict great damage.
enemy_1119_vofsd_2.ability: Starts imprisoned. When imprisoned, ASPD is reduced. Freed after a few attacks. After being freed, gains increased ATK, increased RES, and naturally regenerates HP over time

enemy_1120_vofwiz.name: Caster Prisoner
enemy_1120_vofwiz.description: An inmate with a weak constitution. Due to being unable to overcome his bindings on his own, he's instead learned to utilize defensive techniques using the devices on his body. On the other hand, he's well-versed in Originium Arts and will become very difficult to deal with should he be freed.
enemy_1120_vofwiz.ability: Increases the ASPD of all enemies on the battlefield; When imprisoned, gains increased DEF but is unable to attack; After being freed, attacks two targets at once; Prioritizes attacking Imprisonment Devices.

enemy_1120_vofwiz_2.name: Deadly Caster Prisoner
enemy_1120_vofwiz_2.description: An inmate with a weak constitution. Due to being unable to overcome his bindings on his own, he's instead learned to utilize defensive techniques using the devices on his body. On the other hand, he's extremely well-versed in Originium Arts and will become very difficult to deal with should he be freed.
enemy_1120_vofwiz_2.ability: Greatly increases the ASPD of all enemies on the battlefield; When imprisoned, gains increased DEF but is unable to attack; After being freed, attacks two targets at once; Prioritizes attacking Imprisonment Devices.

enemy_1121_lifbos.name: Recidivist
enemy_1121_lifbos.description: A vicious inmate feared by inmates and guards alike. Has learned patience after his long stay in prison, and pays no attention to normal attacks and provocations. However, avoid enraging him at all costs, or be prepared to face the consequences.
enemy_1121_lifbos.ability: Starts imprisoned. When imprisoned, ASPD is reduced and DEF is increased. Freed after a few attacks. After being freed, gains increased ATK. When freed for the first time, immediately frees all other enemies

enemy_1121_lifbos_2.name: Infamous Recidivist
enemy_1121_lifbos_2.description: A legendary prisoner whose might is second only to that of Anthony. Has learned patience after his long stay in prison, and pays no attention to normal attacks and provocations. However, avoid enraging him at all costs, or be prepared to face the consequences.
enemy_1121_lifbos_2.ability: Starts imprisoned. When imprisoned, ASPD is reduced and DEF is increased. Freed after a few attacks. After being freed, gains increased ATK. When freed for the first time, immediately frees all other enemies

enemy_1122_sphond.name: 'Angry'
enemy_1122_sphond.description: A beastly Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. It has a bad temper and likes to eat apricots. It follows its master's wishes and frolics about in the painting scroll, occasionally taking a bite out of it.

enemy_1122_sphond_2.name: Anxious 'Angry'
enemy_1122_sphond_2.description: A beastly Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. It has an even worse temper and doesn't want to eat apricots anymore. It follows its master's wishes and frolics about in the painting scroll, occasionally taking a bite out of it.

enemy_1123_spsbr.name: 'Bitey'
enemy_1123_spsbr.description: A common Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. It's very smart and actually understands human speech. Apparently some kind of communal organism, it gets lonely when left by itself. It has done many a mean thing out of amusement for it's just an Ink Spirit, no matter how smart.

enemy_1123_spsbr_2.name: Serious 'Bitey'
enemy_1123_spsbr_2.description: A common Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. It's very smart and actually understands human speech. Apparently some kind of communal organism, it gets lonely when left by itself. Now it's actually getting down to business like a real Ink Spirit.

enemy_1124_spbow.name: 'Stabby'
enemy_1124_spbow.description: A crafty Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. Very proud of itself and its tricks. Not above letting its allies charge straight into traps before betraying them. It will prioritize attacking opposite attribute enemies.

enemy_1124_spbow_2.name: Flanking 'Stabby'
enemy_1124_spbow_2.description: A crafty Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. Very proud of itself and its tricks. Instinctively suppresses its enemies by attacking their weak spots for damage. It will prioritize attacking opposite attribute enemies.

enemy_1125_spshld.name: 'Lazy'
enemy_1125_spshld.description: A majestic Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. Looks weird, just like it's carrying a mountain on its back. Since it doesn't move much, it's often taken for a decorative feature. Can draw enemies to attack it, unfathomably tough.
enemy_1125_spshld.ability: More likely to be targeted by attacks.

enemy_1125_spshld_2.name: Unmoving 'Lazy'
enemy_1125_spshld_2.description: A majestic Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. Looks weird, just like it's carrying a mountain on its back. As still as a mountain when not moving, but bears down on its enemies like boulders tumbling down a mountain when in a team. Can draw enemies to attack it, unfathomably tough.
enemy_1125_spshld_2.ability: More likely to be targeted by attacks.

enemy_1126_spslme.name: 'Smarty'
enemy_1126_spslme.description: A strange Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. Seems to be alive. Very lively with its movements and likes to wander around. Not very commonly seen as it explodes if it touches any fellow Ink Spirits with opposite attributes.
enemy_1126_spslme.ability: Can only be blocked by player's units of the same attribute. Explodes upon death, dealing Arts damage to our units. Causes even greater damage if friendly units of opposite attribute are in its vicinity.

enemy_1126_spslme_2.name: Dazzled 'Smarty'
enemy_1126_spslme_2.description: A strange Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. Seems to be alive. Very lively with its movements and likes to wander around. It explodes if it touches any fellow Ink Spirits with opposite attributes, so any survivors tend to be even more powerful.
enemy_1126_spslme_2.ability: Can only be blocked by player's units of the same attribute. Explodes upon death, dealing Arts damage to our units. Causes even greater damage if friendly units of opposite attribute are in its vicinity.

enemy_1127_sptrkg.name: 'Blindey'
enemy_1127_sptrkg.description: A reckless Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. Rushes forward single-mindedly, its surroundings be damned, and tends to find itself in all kinds of predicaments because of that. Doesn't get along with Stabby. Can only be blocked by units of the same attribute.
enemy_1127_sptrkg.ability: Can only be blocked by player's units of the same attribute.

enemy_1127_sptrkg_2.name: Indefatigable 'Blindey'
enemy_1127_sptrkg_2.description: A reckless Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. Still rushes forward single-mindedly, as though its sole purpose in life is to march forward. Doesn't get along with Stabby. Can only be blocked by units of the same attribute.
enemy_1127_sptrkg_2.ability: Can only be blocked by player's units of the same attribute.

enemy_1128_spmage.name: 'Envy'
enemy_1128_spmage.description: A fearsome Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. Frightening in appearance and feared by all. Very territorial and doesn't get along with most other Ink Spirits. Actually a very nervous guy who has trouble sleeping. Arts can shift Hui and Ming.
enemy_1128_spmage.ability: Can charge its attacks. If not interrupted, causes Arts damage and shifts target's Ming and Hui attribute.

enemy_1128_spmage_2.name: Complicated 'Envy'
enemy_1128_spmage_2.description: A fearsome Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. Frightening in appearance and feared by all. Very territorial and doesn't get along with most other Ink Spirits. Its emotions and behavioral patterns are particularly complex, perhaps even more so than mere man. Arts can shift Hui and Ming.
enemy_1128_spmage_2.ability: Can charge its attacks. If not interrupted, causes Arts damage and shifts target's Ming and Hui attribute.

enemy_1129_spklr.name: 'Fury'
enemy_1129_spklr.description: A strong Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. Large and robust, but not very good at thinking. Tends to fall into the simplest traps and needs Bitey to save its ass. Gains attack power against opposite attribute enemies.
enemy_1129_spklr.ability: Greatly increases ATK when attacking opposite attribute targets

enemy_1129_spklr_2.name: Unbridled 'Fury'
enemy_1129_spklr_2.description: A strong Ink Spirit named by the painter herself. Its great power and might is how it frees itself from the worries of having to think, allowing it to destroy all in its wake with its flaming inferno. Other than its buddy Bitey, that is. Gains attack power against opposite attribute enemies.
enemy_1129_spklr_2.ability: Greatly increases ATK when attacking opposite attribute targets

enemy_1130_infstr.name: Originiutant Puppet
enemy_1130_infstr.description: A corpse being controlled by a parasitic Originiutant Excrescence.

enemy_1131_sbeast.name: Mutant Sand Beast
enemy_1131_sbeast.description: A sand beast infected by an Originiutant. Sand beasts are a species of small-sized omnivores that primarily inhabit deserts and hamadas. They are nocturnal in nature and are often tamed by the local Sargonians to be used as hunting beasts.

enemy_1131_sbeast_2.name: Mutant Sand Beast α
enemy_1131_sbeast_2.description: A sand beast infected and severely mutated by an Originiutant. Sand beasts are a species of small-sized omnivores that primarily inhabit deserts and hamadas. They are nocturnal in nature and are often tamed by the local Sargonians to be used as hunting beasts.

enemy_1132_sarchn.name: Mutant Rock Spider
enemy_1132_sarchn.description: A rock spider infected by an Originiutant. Due to their similar appearances, rock spiders are often mistakenly believed to be a close relative of Infused Originium Slugs. However, the latest research shows that they are two completely different species.

enemy_1132_sarchn_2.name: Mutant Rock Spider α
enemy_1132_sarchn_2.description: A rock spider infected and severely mutated by an Originiutant. Due to their similar appearances, rock spiders are often mistakenly believed to be a close relative of Infused Originium Slugs. However, the latest research shows that they are two completely different species.

enemy_1133_harchn.name: Mutant Giant Rock Spider
enemy_1133_harchn.description: A giant rock spider infected by an Originiutant. Giant rock spiders are a subspecies of rock spider found only in Sargon. They possess a large circular abdomen used to store energy.
enemy_1133_harchn.ability: Periodically creates an <Originiutant Excrescence>; Splits into 4 <Originiutant Excrescences> upon death

enemy_1133_harchn_2.name: Mutant Giant Rock Spider α
enemy_1133_harchn_2.description: A giant rock spider infected and severely mutated by an Originiutant. Giant rock spiders are a subspecies of rock spider found only in Sargon. They possess a large circular abdomen used to store energy.
enemy_1133_harchn_2.ability: Periodically creates an <Originiutant Tumor>; Splits into 4 <Originiutant Tumors> upon death

enemy_1134_diamd.name: Originiutant
enemy_1134_diamd.description: An Originiutant mutant that was weaponized for some purpose. Possesses an incredibly tough outer shell.

enemy_1134_diamd_2.name: Originiutant α
enemy_1134_diamd_2.description: An Originiutant mutant that was weaponized for some purpose. Even more ferocious and terrifying than usual.

enemy_1135_redman.name: 'Redmark' Eradicator
enemy_1135_redman.description: A special mercenary sniper who excels at ambushing targets exposed in harsh environments. 'Redmark Contracts' are tailor-made for elite and powerful mercenaries with a distinct lack of morals. The initiators of such contracts are ruthless and definitely up to no good.
enemy_1135_redman.ability: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>; Only performs ranged attacks against allied units caught inside the <Sandstorm>

enemy_1135_redman_2.name: 'Redmark' Elite Eradicator
enemy_1135_redman_2.description: An elite mercenary sniper who excels at ambushing targets exposed in harsh environments. 'Redmark Contracts' are tailor-made for elite and powerful mercenaries with a distinct lack of morals. The initiators of such contracts are ruthless and definitely up to no good.
enemy_1135_redman_2.ability: <$ba.invisible>Invisible</>; Only performs ranged attacks against allied units caught inside the <Sandstorm>

enemy_1136_redace.name: 'Redmark' Infiltrator
enemy_1136_redace.description: A special mercenary infiltrator who carries high-tech projection equipment, specializing in infiltrating enemy forces within harsh environments. 'Redmark Contracts' are tailor-made for elite and powerful mercenaries with a distinct lack of morals. The initiators of such contracts are ruthless and definitely up to no good.
enemy_1136_redace.ability: When receiving damage for the first time, creates a <Holographic Mirage>; While the mirage exists, cannot be blocked and become less likely to be attacked; Gains Physical and Arts Dodge while within the Sandstorm

enemy_1136_redace_2.name: 'Redmark' Elite Infiltrator
enemy_1136_redace_2.description: An elite mercenary infiltrator who carries high-tech projection equipment, specializing in infiltrating enemy forces within harsh environments. 'Redmark Contracts' are tailor-made for elite and powerful mercenaries with a distinct lack of morals. The initiators of such contracts are ruthless and definitely up to no good.
enemy_1136_redace_2.ability: When receiving damage for the first time, creates a <Holographic Mirage MK2>; While the mirage exists, cannot be blocked and become less likely to be attacked; Gains Physical and Arts Dodge while within the Sandstorm

enemy_1137_plasm.name: Originiutant Excrescence
enemy_1137_plasm.description: A twisted organism born under the combined effects of radiation mutation and Originium infection.
enemy_1137_plasm.ability: Drains 1 Objective HP when entering the Objective Point

enemy_1138_tumor.name: Originiutant Tumor
enemy_1138_tumor.description: A twisted organism born under the combined effects of radiation mutation and Originium infection. The malign tumors on these organisms' bodies still contain a large amount of hazardous substances.
enemy_1138_tumor.ability: Drains 1 Objective HP when entering the Objective Point; When blocked, significantly reduces the blocker's ASPD

enemy_1139_hologc.name: Holographic Mirage
enemy_1139_hologc.description: Tactical Originium Equipment developed by a certain Columbian tech company. Generates a realistic holographic projection to obstruct enemies.

enemy_1139_hologc_2.name: Holographic Mirage MK2
enemy_1139_hologc_2.description: The newest model of Tactical Originium Equipment developed by a certain Columbian tech company. Generates a realistic holographic projection to obstruct enemies.

enemy_1140_merhd.name: Tactical Hound
enemy_1140_merhd.description: An infected creature controlled by a Caster. Hounds are widely used by mercenaries, though some Perros object to it.

enemy_1140_merhd_2.name: Tactical Hound Pro
enemy_1140_merhd_2.description: An infected creature controlled by a Caster. Having gone through rigorous training, they now pose a much greater threat. Hounds are widely used by mercenaries, though some Perros object to it.

enemy_1141_merbow.name: Tactical Crossbowman
enemy_1141_merbow.description: A mercenary using ranged weaponry. Uses a crossbow in battle and calls for the offensive Air Support Drone 'Scrap' to carry out aerial bombardment.
enemy_1141_merbow.ability: Before the first attack, calls for <Scrap> to support the battle from the <Mobile Tactical Hangar>

enemy_1141_merbow_2.name: Tactical Crossbowman Leader
enemy_1141_merbow_2.description: A mercenary using ranged weaponry. Uses a crossbow in battle and calls for the more powerful offensive Air Support Drone 'Scrap Model-U' to carry out aerial bombardment.
enemy_1141_merbow_2.ability: Before the first attack, calls for <Scrap Model-U> to support the battle from the <Mobile Tactical Hangar>

enemy_1142_mershd.name: Tactical Defender
enemy_1142_mershd.description: A mercenary clad in heavy armor. Has extremely strong defensive capabilities and utilizes the Air Support Drone 'Anvil' to provide defensive support to their allies.
enemy_1142_mershd.ability: The first time HP drops beneath half, calls for <Anvil> to support the battle from the <Mobile Tactical Hangar>

enemy_1142_mershd_2.name: Tactical Defender Leader
enemy_1142_mershd_2.description: A mercenary clad in heavy armor. Has even stronger defensive capabilities and utilizes the more powerful Air Support Drone 'Anvil Model-B' to provide defensive support to their allies.
enemy_1142_mershd_2.ability: The first time HP drops beneath half, calls for <Anvil Model-B> to support the battle from the <Mobile Tactical Hangar>

enemy_1143_merrpg.name: Anti-Armor Infantry
enemy_1143_merrpg.description: A mercenary specializing in anti-armor combat. Carries a single-use grenade launcher which is discarded after firing along with other non-essential equipment, after which they charge at high speed towards the enemy.
enemy_1143_merrpg.ability: Can fire a super long ranged grenade, dealing AoE Physical damage; After firing, significantly increases Movement Speed and can only perform melee attacks

enemy_1143_merrpg_2.name: Anti-Armor Infantry Leader
enemy_1143_merrpg_2.description: A mercenary specializing in anti-armor combat. Carries a powerful single-use grenade launcher which is discarded after firing along with other non-essential equipment, after which they charge at high speed towards the enemy.
enemy_1143_merrpg_2.ability: Can fire a super long ranged grenade, dealing AoE Physical damage; After firing, significantly increases Movement Speed and can only perform melee attacks

enemy_1144_merlgd.name: War Phantom
enemy_1144_merlgd.description: The 'War Phantoms' were once a legendary band of mercenaries. In the wake of their bloody legacy, mercenaries and bounty hunters began referring to powerful, cruel veteran warriors with the same title. Strong and adept at controlling multiple types of Air Support Drones.
enemy_1144_merlgd.ability: On the first attack, immediately calls for <Scrap> to support the battle from the <Mobile Tactical Hangar>; When HP drops beneath half for the first time, immediately calls for <Anvil> to support the battle from the <Mobile Tactical Hangar>; When on the field, all Air Support Drones have significantly increased Movement Speed

enemy_1144_merlgd_2.name: Legendary War Phantom
enemy_1144_merlgd_2.description: The 'War Phantoms' were once a legendary band of mercenaries. Though countless others have appropriated their name, perhaps the legends themselves have yet to fall. Extremely strong and adept at controlling multiple types of Air Support Drones.
enemy_1144_merlgd_2.ability: On the first attack, immediately calls for <Scrap Model-U> to support the battle from the <Mobile Tactical Hangar>; When HP drops beneath half for the first time, immediately calls for <Anvil Model-B> to support the battle from the <Mobile Tactical Hangar>; When on the field, all Air Support Drones have significantly increased Movement Speed

enemy_1145_atkspd.name: Scrap
enemy_1145_atkspd.description: The enemy's offensive Air Support Drones. Its attacks deal AoE Physical damage and reduce the targets' DEF.
enemy_1145_atkspd.ability: Flying unit; Attacks fire two grenades, significantly reducing the DEF of the target and nearby units for a short period; Difficult to attack; Automatically retreats after some time

enemy_1145_atkspd_2.name: Scrap Model-U
enemy_1145_atkspd_2.description: The enemy's advanced offensive Air Support Drones. Its attacks deal stronger AoE Physical damage and reduce the targets' DEF.
enemy_1145_atkspd_2.ability: Flying unit; Attacks fire two grenades, significantly reducing the DEF of the target and nearby units for a short period; Difficult to attack; Automatically retreats after some time

enemy_1146_defspd.name: Anvil
enemy_1146_defspd.description: The enemy's defensive Air Support Drones. It strengthens the DEF of enemy units within range and slowly recovers their HP.
enemy_1146_defspd.ability: Flying unit; Continually provides DEF increase and HP recovery to nearby enemy units; Difficult to attack; Automatically retreats after some time

enemy_1146_defspd_2.name: Anvil Model-B
enemy_1146_defspd_2.description: The enemy's advanced defensive Air Support Drones. It greatly strengthens the DEF of enemy units within range and gradually recovers their HP.
enemy_1146_defspd_2.ability: Flying unit; Continually provides DEF increase and HP recovery to nearby enemy units; Difficult to attack; Automatically retreats after some time

enemy_1147_dshond.name: Shell Sea Runner
enemy_1147_dshond.description: A Sea Terror that grew four limbs, but lacks an internal skeleton. It seems to have once hunted quadrupeds on land.

enemy_1147_dshond_2.name: Nourished Runner
enemy_1147_dshond_2.description: A Sea Terror that grew four limbs and has sated its hunger. It controls its body's movements using hydraulic pressure and possesses superior reflexes.

enemy_1148_dssbr.name: Deep Sea Slider
enemy_1148_dssbr.description: A Sea Terror that crawled onto the shore. It brandishes its tough appendages menacingly.

enemy_1148_dssbr_2.name: Nourished Slider
enemy_1148_dssbr_2.description: A Sea Terror that crawled onto the shore and has sated its hunger. Its appendages can cause protein denaturation.

enemy_1149_dsbow.name: Ridge Sea Spitter
enemy_1149_dsbow.description: A mysterious Sea Terror. In the sea, it can spit at even greater speeds, fast enough to destroy reefs.

enemy_1149_dsbow_2.name: Nourished Spitter
enemy_1149_dsbow_2.description: A mysterious Sea Terror that has sated its hunger. Its spit is a way to deal with natural disasters, rather than as a means of hunting.

enemy_1150_dsjely.name: Floating Sea Drifter
enemy_1150_dsjely.description: A Sea Terror that floats in the air. It seems that the next generation will be even more proficient at swimming through the air.

enemy_1150_dsjely_2.name: Nourished Drifter
enemy_1150_dsjely_2.description: A Sea Terror that floats in the air and has sated its hunger. Its body contains a blazing-hot organ.

enemy_1151_dslntc.name: Basin Sea Reaper
enemy_1151_dslntc.description: A Sea Terror that emits ear-splitting screeches. Should its nourishment be interrupted, it will immediately counterattack any nearby threats, until all other signs of life have ceased.
enemy_1151_dslntc.ability: Starts battle in Standby and does not attack; After being injured, this unit becomes Combat-Ready, gradually losing HP over time and continually inflicting <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</> to nearby units

enemy_1151_dslntc_2.name: Nourished Reaper
enemy_1151_dslntc_2.description: A Sea Terror that emits ear-splitting screeches and has sated its hunger. It is essentially harmless if you don't disturb it.
enemy_1151_dslntc_2.ability: Starts battle in Standby and does not attack; After being injured, this unit becomes Combat-Ready, gradually losing HP over time and continually inflicting <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</> to nearby units

enemy_1152_dsurch.name: Pocket Sea Crawler
enemy_1152_dsurch.description: A Sea Terror imbued with impurities. The density of its body tissue surpasses that of some alloys. Victims stabbed by it will feel as if they have been set alight.
enemy_1152_dsurch.ability: Does not attack; Whenever a certain percentage of HP is lost, immediately deal a large amount of Arts damage and <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</> to nearby units

enemy_1152_dsurch_2.name: Nourished Crawler
enemy_1152_dsurch_2.description: A Sea Terror imbued with impurities that has had its hunger sated. Such Sea Terrors are rarely seen nowadays, as they are gradually evolving to become more nimble.
enemy_1152_dsurch_2.ability: Does not attack; Whenever a certain percentage of HP is lost, immediately deal a large amount of Arts damage and <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</> to nearby units

enemy_1153_dsexcu.name: Primal Sea Piercer
enemy_1153_dsexcu.description: A Sea Terror that grew a solid organ. The other parts of its body seem to be forming impregnable outer spikes.
enemy_1153_dsexcu.ability: Prioritizes attacking the target with the current lowest HP percentage within a small area

enemy_1153_dsexcu_2.name: Nourished Piercer
enemy_1153_dsexcu_2.description: A Sea Terror that grew a solid organ and has had its hunger sated. It sways gently beneath the moonlight.
enemy_1153_dsexcu_2.ability: Prioritizes attacking the target with the current lowest HP percentage within a small area

enemy_1154_dsmant.name: The First To Talk
enemy_1154_dsmant.description: The first beautiful living being to speak human language before civilized man. Seaborn.
enemy_1154_dsmant.ability: [Corrosive Vacuoles] Unleashes <Corrosive Vacuoles> that deal Physical damage and <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>. Locks-on to the target and a unit in the four adjacent tiles with the lowest <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</> accumulation

enemy_1155_dsrobt.name: Automatic Maintenance Drone
enemy_1155_dsrobt.description: An old Iberian automatic maintenance drone. For some reason, it is still operational and will repair facilities.
enemy_1155_dsrobt.ability: When near a <Emergency Aid Building>, activates it and greatly enhances its ability to recover <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</> damage; Will not deduct Life Points when gets spared or destroyed, but can suffer friendly fire from allied units

enemy_1156_hymhr.name: Hymnoi Hero
enemy_1156_hymhr.description: An instructor employed at the Hymnoi Training Base. Well loved by students and somehow manages to keep their secret binge drinking a secret.
enemy_1156_hymhr.ability: This unit will not deduct Life Points when spared; can only be blocked by units with at least 3 Block; when on the battlefield, naturally regenerates HP of all enemy units; periodically casts Arts, dealing AoE Arts damage and temporarily reduces Operators' Block; once defeated, spawns a healing zone on the spot that heals allied units within range over time

enemy_1157_hymwr.name: Hymnoi Warrior
enemy_1157_hymwr.description: An elite warrior employed at the Hymnoi Training Base. Almost certainly holed up at the theater if it's a day off.
enemy_1157_hymwr.ability: This unit will not deduct Life Points when spared; more likely to be targeted by attacks; receives a shield that lasts a short period of time, granting the unit 100% resistance to Physical, Arts, and True damage as well as Stun, Sleep, Bind, Slow, and Shift statuses; when on the battlefield, all allied units' DEF is reduced slightly; when attacked, unleashes a rain of arrows on all deployed Operators, continuously dealing True damage over a short period; duration is refreshed whenever attacked again

enemy_1158_divman.name: Diver
enemy_1158_divman.description: Their daily tasks involve cleaning up trash from the sea. The barrier to entry is low but the pay is surprisingly good, so there are many who sign up for it.
enemy_1158_divman.ability: Immune to<@eb.key>Erosion</>. While in water, gains increased ATK and <@eb.key>Invisibility</>

enemy_1158_divman_2.name: Diver Leader
enemy_1158_divman_2.description: Having been trained in professional diving, they are able to reach the floor of the artificial sea and can be called the elites of the water. Even so, most of them don't dare to try it in the real seas.
enemy_1158_divman_2.ability: Immune to<@eb.key>Erosion</>. While in water, gains increased ATK and <@eb.key>Invisibility</>

enemy_1159_swfmob.name: Delinquent
enemy_1159_swfmob.description: The most commonly seen get-up of Dossoles's delinquents. They intermingle with tourists, ready to join in a fight at any time. Agile and nimble, they can dodge ranged Physical attacks.
enemy_1159_swfmob.ability: Has a chance to dodge Physical attacks when not blocked

enemy_1159_swfmob_2.name: Delinquent Boss
enemy_1159_swfmob_2.description: The favored get-up of pretentious delinquents. They intermingle with tourists, ready to join in a fight at any time. Better at fighting than regular delinquents, they will instinctively dodge ranged Physical attacks.
enemy_1159_swfmob_2.ability: Has a chance to dodge Physical attacks when not blocked

enemy_1160_hvyslr.name: Dockworker
enemy_1160_hvyslr.description: Brawny brutes who work at the docks or on Pancho's ships. They enjoy playing cards and drinking, and usually spend the day in a drunken haze. Because they regularly work around seawater, they're more subjected to Erosion.
enemy_1160_hvyslr.ability: Can <@eb.key>Stun</> player's units after a few attacks. Quickly loses HP while under the effects of 'Erosion'

enemy_1160_hvyslr_2.name: Dockworker Leader
enemy_1160_hvyslr_2.description: Giant brutes who work at the docks or on Pancho's ships. They enjoy playing cards and drinking, and usually spend the day in a drunken haze. They're much more robust than regular dockworkers, but they are still quite subjected to Erosion.
enemy_1160_hvyslr_2.ability: Can <@eb.key>Stun</> player's units after a few attacks. Quickly loses HP while under the effects of 'Erosion'

enemy_1161_tidmag.name: Tidal Caster
enemy_1161_tidmag.description: Professionally trained casters whose duties involve simulating the tides of Dossoles's sea. Adept at using Originium Arts that mimic the erosive effect of the tides.
enemy_1161_tidmag.ability: Attacks deal damage to the target and all allied units in the target's four adjacent tiles, additionally inflicting <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</>

enemy_1161_tidmag_2.name: Tidal Leader
enemy_1161_tidmag_2.description: The elites among the Tidal Casters. They are in charge of leading and supervising the Tidal Casters. Extremely adept at using Originium Arts that mimic the erosive effect of the tides.
enemy_1161_tidmag_2.ability: Attacks deal damage to the target and all allied units in the target's four adjacent tiles, additionally inflicting <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</>

enemy_1162_magmot.name: Caster Speedboat
enemy_1162_magmot.description: A Tidal Caster on a speedboat. The Caster will continue battle after the vehicle is destroyed.
enemy_1162_magmot.ability: Attacks deal damage to the target and all allied units in the target's four adjacent tiles, additionally inflicting <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</>. The Caster will continue battle after the vehicle is destroyed

enemy_1162_magmot_2.name: Tidal Leader Speedboat
enemy_1162_magmot_2.description: A Tidal Leader on a speedboat. The Tidal Leader will continue battle after the vehicle is destroyed.
enemy_1162_magmot_2.ability: Attacks deal damage to the target and all allied units in the target's four adjacent tiles, additionally inflicting <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</>. The Caster will continue battle after the vehicle is destroyed

enemy_1163_hvymot.name: Dockworker Motorboat
enemy_1163_hvymot.description: A Dockworker on a motorboat. The Dockworker will continue battle after the vehicle is destroyed.
enemy_1163_hvymot.ability: Can only be blocked by units with at least 3 Block. Deals Physical damage by colliding with player's units. The Dockworker will continue battle after the vehicle is destroyed

enemy_1163_hvymot_2.name: Dockworker Leader Motorboat
enemy_1163_hvymot_2.description: A Dockworker Leader on a motorboat. The Dockworker Leader will continue battle after the vehicle is destroyed.
enemy_1163_hvymot_2.ability: Can only be blocked by units with at least 3 Block. Deals Physical damage by colliding with player's units. The Dockworker will continue battle after the vehicle is destroyed

enemy_1164_bmbmot.name: Unmanned Explosive Boat
enemy_1164_bmbmot.description: An overloaded unmanned explosive boat. Causes Corrosion Damage after exploding
enemy_1164_bmbmot.ability: Deals Physical damage and <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</> to surrounding units upon destruction

enemy_1164_bmbmot_2.name: Unmanned Heavy Explosive Boat
enemy_1164_bmbmot_2.description: An overloaded unmanned explosive boat with even more explosives. Causes Corrosion Damage after exploding
enemy_1164_bmbmot_2.ability: Deals Physical damage and <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</> to surrounding units upon destruction

enemy_1164_bmbmot_3.name: Pancho's Explosive Boat
enemy_1164_bmbmot_3.description: An overloaded unmanned explosive boat under the control of Pancho's underlings. Causes Corrosion Damage after exploding
enemy_1164_bmbmot_3.ability: Deals Physical damage and <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</> to surrounding units upon destruction

enemy_3003_alymot.name: Competition Transport Vessel
enemy_3003_alymot.description: A transport vessel carrying supplies for setting up the competition venues. All competitors have the duty of protecting it from attacks.
enemy_3003_alymot.ability: Does not deduct Life Points when spared. Enemies prioritize attacking this unit; unit will deduct 1 Life Point upon destruction; does not count towards the defeated enemies counter

enemy_1165_duhond.name: Dublinn Sniffer Hound
enemy_1165_duhond.description: An organism controlled by the Dublinn forces. They were originally purchased from a mercenary group. Equipped with a refractive mask crafted by Shadowcasters, they are rather resistant to regular Originium Arts.

enemy_1165_duhond_2.name: Dublinn Sniffer Hound Pro
enemy_1165_duhond_2.description: An organism controlled by the Dublinn forces, they are stronger in combat than the average Hound. They were originally purchased from a mercenary group, and have undergone training for a longer period. Equipped with a refractive mask crafted by Shadowcasters, they are rather resistant to regular Originium Arts.

enemy_1166_dusbr.name: Dublinn Scout
enemy_1166_dusbr.description: A scout for the Dublinn forces. With superb concealment techniques, they are the cornerstone of the Dublinn forces' guerilla maneuvers. Equipped with a refractive mask crafted by Shadowcasters, they are rather resistant to regular Originium Arts.

enemy_1166_dusbr_2.name: Dublinn Scout Leader
enemy_1166_dusbr_2.description: A scout leader in the Dublinn forces. The scouts under their command are the cornerstone of the Dublinn forces' guerilla maneuvers. Equipped with a refractive mask crafted by Shadowcasters, they are rather resistant to regular Originium Arts.

enemy_1167_dubow.name: Dublinn Sniper
enemy_1167_dubow.description: A sniper in the Dublinn forces. The crossbows they wield bear the signs of Columbian modification. Equipped with a refractive mask crafted by Shadowcasters, they are rather resistant to regular Originium Arts.

enemy_1167_dubow_2.name: Dublinn Sniper Leader
enemy_1167_dubow_2.description: A sniper leader in the Dublinn forces. The crossbows they wield bear the signs of Columbian modification and have much greater penetration power. Equipped with a refractive mask crafted by Shadowcasters, they are rather resistant to regular Originium Arts.

enemy_1168_dumage.name: Dublinn Shadowcaster
enemy_1168_dumage.description: A caster in the Dublinn forces. Their Originium Arts do not stand out, but their innovative breakthrough in mass-producing Arts-resistant masks has placed them in good standing amongst the Dublinn forces.

enemy_1168_dumage_2.name: Dublinn Shadowcaster Leader
enemy_1168_dumage_2.description: A caster leader in the Dublinn forces. Their Originium Arts do not stand out, but the innovative breakthrough of the casters under their command in mass-producing Arts-resistant masks has granted them considerable recognition from their leader.

enemy_1169_duphlx.name: Dublinn Phalanx Infantry
enemy_1169_duphlx.description: A phalanx infantry in the Dublinn forces. The phalanx tactics they utilize evolved from the combat formations used in Gaul. In the phalanx, nearby infantry will support one another, increasing the might of the formation.
enemy_1169_duphlx.ability: When other Phalanx Infantry are nearby, DEF increases (Stacks); <$ba.refraction>Refraction</>

enemy_1169_duphlx_2.name: Dublinn Phalanx Commander
enemy_1169_duphlx_2.description: A phalanx commander in the Dublinn forces, they organize the infantry under their command into phalanx formations. The phalanx tactics they utilize evolved from the combat formations used in Gaul. In the phalanx, nearby infantry will support one another, increasing the might of the formation.
enemy_1169_duphlx_2.ability: When other Phalanx Commanders are nearby, DEF increases (Stacks); <$ba.refraction>Refraction</>

enemy_1170_dushld.name: Dublinn Heavy Defender
enemy_1170_dushld.description: A heavy defender in the Dublinn forces. The armor technology they use comes from Victoria, while their boots were designed in Leithanien. Their shields look extremely similar to a newly patented product from Kazimierz's Roar Guards Company.

enemy_1170_dushld_2.name: Dublinn Heavy Defender Leader
enemy_1170_dushld_2.description: A heavy defender leader in the Dublinn forces, they wield much more sophisticated equipment. The armor technology they use comes from Victoria, while their boots were designed in Leithanien. Their shields look extremely similar to a newly patented product from Kazimierz's Roar Guards Company.

enemy_1171_durokt.name: Dublinn Flying Soldier
enemy_1171_durokt.description: A flying soldier in the Dublinn forces. The steam propulsion device they use originates from a secret laboratory owned by the Victorian military. As it has only recently been deployed in battle, its power output is still unstable.

enemy_1171_durokt_2.name: Dublinn Flying Squad Leader
enemy_1171_durokt_2.description: A flying squad leader in the Dublinn forces. The steam propulsion device they use originates from a secret laboratory owned by the Victorian military and has gone through many iterations. Its power output is relatively stable.

enemy_1172_dugago.name: Tombkeeper Grotesque
enemy_1172_dugago.description: A special Arts creation from the Dublinn forces, created by their leader Mandragora. According to Mandragora, back when she was studying Originium Arts in an outskirts cemetery, the Tombkeeper Grotesque was her first companion. Its outer appearance has gone through many redesigns, with the latest being based off a Sarkaz from an ancient bloodline.
enemy_1172_dugago.ability: After first defeat, temporarily transforms into a stone statue with extremely high DEF, then revives as an aerial unit; <$ba.refraction>Refraction</>

enemy_1172_dugago_2.name: Enraged Tombkeeper Grotesque
enemy_1172_dugago_2.description: A special Arts creation from the Dublinn forces, created by their leader Mandragora. According to Mandragora, back when she was studying Originium Arts in an outskirts cemetery, the Tombkeeper Grotesque was her first companion. Its outer appearance has gone through many redesigns, with the latest being based off a Sarkaz from an ancient bloodline. This series of Tombkeepers embodies Mandragora's fury towards Victoria.
enemy_1172_dugago_2.ability: After first defeat, temporarily transforms into a stone statue with extremely high DEF, then revives as an aerial unit; <$ba.refraction>Refraction</>

enemy_1173_duspfr.name: Dublinn Flamerazer
enemy_1173_duspfr.description: A special squad that uses flamethrowers in the Dublinn forces. Their leader's teachings reverberate in their minds as they seek to reforge Terra amidst the endless flames.
enemy_1173_duspfr.ability: Continually deals Arts damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn Damage</> within the skill duration; <@eb.key>Upon death, explodes</> and deals Arts damage, knocking down nearby <@eb.key>Tattered Pillars</> and instantly defeating other <@eb.key>Dublinn Flamerazers</>

enemy_1173_duspfr_2.name: Dublinn Flamerazer Leader
enemy_1173_duspfr_2.description: A leader of a special squad that uses flamethrowers in the Dublinn forces. Their leader's teachings reverberate in their minds as they seek to reforge Terra amidst the endless flames.
enemy_1173_duspfr_2.ability: Continually deals Arts damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn Damage</> within the skill duration; <@eb.key>Upon death, explodes</> and deals Arts damage, knocking down nearby <@eb.key>Tattered Pillars</> and instantly defeating other <@eb.key>Dublinn Flamerazers</>

enemy_1174_duholy.name: Dublinn Companion Guard
enemy_1174_duholy.description: A member of the Dublinn forces' elite operations squad. The structure of this squad mimics the military system of ancient Minos. The shields they wield are the culmination of many nations' technologies, providing cover for their partners while advancing, and protecting all nearby allies from harm.
enemy_1174_duholy.ability: More likely to be targeted; When <@eb.key>Companion Shadowblade</> is nearby, activates a field that <@eb.key>reduces nearby Operators' ASPD</>; <$ba.refraction>Refraction</>

enemy_1174_duholy_2.name: Dublinn Elite Companion Guard
enemy_1174_duholy_2.description: A member of the Dublinn forces' elite operations squad, they are much stronger than regular squad members. The shields they wield are the culmination of many nations' technologies, providing cover for their partners while advancing, and protecting all nearby allies from harm.
enemy_1174_duholy_2.ability: More likely to be targeted; When <@eb.key>Elite Companion Shadowblade</> is nearby, activates a field that <@eb.key>reduces nearby Operators' ASPD</>; <$ba.refraction>Refraction</>

enemy_1175_dushdo.name: Dublinn Companion Shadowblade
enemy_1175_dushdo.description: A member of the Dublinn forces' elite operations squad. The structure of this squad mimics the military system of ancient Minos. When they move alongside their partners, they gain powerful stealth capabilities and their attacks are much swifter.
enemy_1175_dushdo.ability: <$ba.invisible>Invisibility</>; When <@eb.key>Companion Guard</> is nearby, gains significantly increased ASPD

enemy_1175_dushdo_2.name: Dublinn Elite Companion Shadowblade
enemy_1175_dushdo_2.description: A member of the Dublinn forces' elite operations squad, they are much stronger than regular squad members. When they move alongside their partners, they gain powerful stealth capabilities and their attacks are much swifter.
enemy_1175_dushdo_2.ability: <$ba.invisible>Invisibility</>; When <@eb.key>Elite Companion Guard</> is nearby, gains significantly increased ASPD

enemy_1176_dusocr.name: Dublinn Evocator
enemy_1176_dusocr.description: An evocation caster in the Dublinn forces who can control fireballs. Their leader's teachings reverberate in their minds as they work to purify the corruption of Terra in raging flames.
enemy_1176_dusocr.ability: Controls <@eb.key>Purifying Flames</> that move along the ground and explode after hitting a melee Operator, dealing Arts Damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn Damage</>.The damage dealt decreases with distance moved

enemy_1176_dusocr_2.name: Dublinn Evocator Leader
enemy_1176_dusocr_2.description: An evocation caster leader in the Dublinn forces who can control fireballs, they are more adept at using Originium Arts than their underlings. Their leader's teachings reverberate in their minds as they work to purify the corruption of Terra in raging flames.
enemy_1176_dusocr_2.ability: Controls <@eb.key>Purifying Flames</> that move along the ground and explode after hitting a melee Operator, dealing Arts Damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn Damage</>.The damage dealt decreases with distance moved

enemy_1178_dscorp.name: Undertide Gloompincer
enemy_1178_dscorp.description: A Gloompincer that escaped from the arenas and adapted to life in the city's sewers. It has grown used to the darkness and has increased Movement Speed under the cover of night.
enemy_1178_dscorp.ability: When in areas with no visibility, Movement Speed increases

enemy_1178_dscorp_2.name: Undertide Gloompincer α
enemy_1178_dscorp_2.description: A Gloompincer that escaped from the arenas and adapted to life in the city's sewers. It has grown used to the darkness and become much more savage. It has increased Movement Speed under the cover of night.
enemy_1178_dscorp_2.ability: When in areas with no visibility, Movement Speed increases

enemy_1179_aruarw.name: Armorless Union Crossbowman
enemy_1179_aruarw.description: A crossbowman hired by the Armorless Union, lurking in the city's shadows. They are adept at hiding in the darkness and assassinating their targets with special bolts.
enemy_1179_aruarw.ability: When in areas with no visibility, attacks deal Arts damage

enemy_1179_aruarw_2.name: Armorless Union Crossbowman Leader
enemy_1179_aruarw_2.description: A crossbowman leader hired by the Armorless Union, lurking in the city's shadows and posing a greater threat. They are adept at hiding in the darkness and assassinating their targets with special bolts.
enemy_1179_aruarw_2.ability: When in areas with no visibility, attacks deal Arts damage

enemy_1180_aruass.name: Armorless Union Assassin
enemy_1180_aruass.description: An assassin hired by the Armorless Union, making up for their average skills with clever plots. They are adept at hiding in the darkness, sharpening their blades and continually increasing their ATK.
enemy_1180_aruass.ability: When in areas with no visibility, ATK continuously increases, and resets after the next attack

enemy_1180_aruass_2.name: Armorless Union Assassin Leader
enemy_1180_aruass_2.description: An assassin hired by the Armorless Union, complementing their remarkable skills with clever plots. They are adept at hiding in the darkness, sharpening their blades and continually increasing their ATK.
enemy_1180_aruass_2.ability: When in areas with no visibility, ATK continuously increases, and resets after the next attack

enemy_1181_napkgt.name: Knight Territory Wanderer
enemy_1181_napkgt.description: A commonly seen burly knight whose Knightclub affiliation is unknown, considered rogue. They're often found passed out drunk in dark alleyways, and demonstrate violent tendencies when woken up.
enemy_1181_napkgt.ability: Remains 'Standby' for a certain period in areas with no visibility and does not attack; If visibility is gained on its location, immediately becomes active

enemy_1181_napkgt_2.name: Knight Territory Hibernator
enemy_1181_napkgt_2.description: A commonly seen burly knight whose Knightclub affiliation is unknown, considered rogue. They're often found passed out drunk in dark alleyways, and should be avoided as they demonstrate ferociously violent tendencies when woken up.
enemy_1181_napkgt_2.ability: Remains 'Standby' for a certain period in areas with no visibility and does not attack; If visibility is gained on its location, immediately becomes active

enemy_1182_flasrt.name: Armorless Union Third Squad
enemy_1182_flasrt.description: A member of the squad led by Monique. As a member handpicked by the Lazurite based on her preferences, they have a much higher wage. Their attacks inflict Corrosion Damage.
enemy_1182_flasrt.ability: Attacks inflict a certain amount of <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</>; After several attacks, the next attack deals increased damage

enemy_1182_flasrt_2.name: Armorless Union Third Squad Leader
enemy_1182_flasrt_2.description: A leader of the squad led by Monique and will take charge when Monique is absent. As a member handpicked by the Lazurite based on her preferences, they have an insanely high wage. Their attacks inflict Corrosion Damage.
enemy_1182_flasrt_2.ability: Attacks inflict a certain amount of <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</>; After several attacks, the next attack deals increased damage

enemy_1182_flasrt_3.name: Lazurite, Monique
enemy_1182_flasrt_3.description: A Lazurite of the Armorless Union, Monique. She has a habit of recording her own condition in great detail before operations. She hates Roy and anyone who interrupts her work.
enemy_1182_flasrt_3.ability: Attacks inflict a certain amount of <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</>; After several attacks, the next attack deals increased damage

enemy_1183_mlasrt.name: Armorless Union Cleanup Squad
enemy_1183_mlasrt.description: A member of the cleanup squad personally trained by Roy. Most of the time, Roy takes a hands-off attitude with the squad, so they have adopted some kind of bounty system and are often very thorough in their tasks. Their attacks inflict Corrosion Damage.
enemy_1183_mlasrt.ability: Attacks inflict a certain amount of <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</>; After several attacks, the next attack deals increased damage

enemy_1183_mlasrt_2.name: Armorless Union Cleanup Squad Leader
enemy_1183_mlasrt_2.description: A leader of the cleanup squad personally trained by Roy. They lead the squad in place of Roy, who refuses to work, and are very experienced. The squad has adopted some kind of bounty system and is often very thorough in their tasks. Their attacks inflict Corrosion Damage.
enemy_1183_mlasrt_2.ability: Attacks inflict a certain amount of <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</>; After several attacks, the next attack deals increased damage

enemy_1183_mlasrt_3.name: Lazurite, Roy
enemy_1183_mlasrt_3.description: A Lazurite of the Armorless Union, Roy. No one knows how a killer managed to achieve such a position and hold it for so many years. Rumor says that his wealth has already surpassed the CEOs of some small companies, while his power exceeds many competition knights.
enemy_1183_mlasrt_3.ability: Attacks inflict a certain amount of <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</>; After several attacks, the next attack deals increased damage

enemy_1184_cadkgt.name: Nova Knightclub Trainee
enemy_1184_cadkgt.description: A trainee of the Nova Knightclub. With the Candle Knight as its figurehead, this Knightclub with a beautiful name recruits elegant knights proficient in using Arts from far and wide. Though there is occasional displeasure over being forced to imitate the Candle Knight, the popularity and wealth it brings remain a big draw of the Knightclub.
enemy_1184_cadkgt.ability: After charging for some time, casts Glimmering Touch on all units surrounding the target, dealing a large amount of Arts damage. While charging, loses <$ba.invisible>invisibility</>

enemy_1184_cadkgt_2.name: Nova Knightclub Elite
enemy_1184_cadkgt_2.description: An elite of the Nova Knightclub. With the Candle Knight as its figurehead, this Knightclub with a beautiful name recruits elegant knights proficient in using Arts from far and wide. Many of these elites have achieved great mastery over their Arts, some even plotting to overthrow the Candle Knight.
enemy_1184_cadkgt_2.ability: After charging for some time, casts Glimmering Touch on all units surrounding the target, dealing a large amount of Arts damage. While charging, loses <$ba.invisible>invisibility</>

enemy_1184_cadkgt_3.name: The Candle Knight Viviana
enemy_1184_cadkgt_3.description: The Candle Knight, Viviana Droste. Words fail to describe her beauty, her brilliant eyes alone are enchanting enough. Tonight, the marigolds bloom for her.
enemy_1184_cadkgt_3.ability: After charging for some time, casts Glimmering Touch on all units surrounding the target, dealing a large amount of Arts damage. While charging, loses <$ba.invisible>invisibility</>

enemy_1185_nmekgt.name: Nightzmora Imitator
enemy_1185_nmekgt.description: Pretenders who began following Nightmare Knight after his battles and 'Performance Art'. Though the form is true, the substance is lacking. Perhaps they can be considered a type of fan as well.
enemy_1185_nmekgt.ability: Casts Coalescing Fear on all Operators with no visibility behind them, dealing Physical damage once

enemy_1185_nmekgt_2.name: Nightzmora Follower
enemy_1185_nmekgt_2.description: Pretenders who began following Nightmare Knight after his battles and 'Performance Art'. Many attempt to guess at the true identity of the Nightzmora from ancient texts and history books, even though he himself considers it blasphemy against the ancient rituals.
enemy_1185_nmekgt_2.ability: Casts Coalescing Fear on all Operators with no visibility behind them, dealing Physical damage once

enemy_1185_nmekgt_3.name: 'The Last Kheshig', Tola
enemy_1185_nmekgt_3.description: The Nightzmora has never acknowledged his knightly title. The city and civilization itself are nothing but obstacles on his path of conquest. The meaning modern Kazimierz bestows upon the knights represents a total desecration of his history to which he is so devoted.
enemy_1185_nmekgt_3.ability: Casts Coalescing Fear on all Operators with no visibility behind them, dealing Physical damage once

enemy_1186_bldbld.name: Bloodblade
enemy_1186_bldbld.description: Blood that bows to the will of the Blood Knight, re-animating and coagulating into the shape of a sharp blade.
enemy_1186_bldbld.ability: Does not deplete Life Points when spared; After coming into contact with the Blood Knight, disappears and restores a certain amount of the Blood Knight's HP

enemy_1187_krghd.name: Clawbeast
enemy_1187_krghd.description: A wild beast that began appearing in the wilderness several decades ago. Depending on differences in the environment, their bodies and organs undergo various changes.

enemy_1187_krghd_2.name: Ferocious Clawbeast
enemy_1187_krghd_2.description: A wild beast that began appearing in the wilderness several decades ago. Depending on differences in the environment, their bodies and organs undergo various changes.

enemy_1188_krgdrn.name: Frigid
enemy_1188_krgdrn.description: A custom drone made-to-order for Karlan Trade. It has been modified for operation in sub-zero temperatures.

enemy_1188_krgdrn_2.name: Frigid AS.T
enemy_1188_krgdrn_2.description: An advanced custom drone made-to-order for Karlan Trade. Not only can it maintain operation in sub-zero temperatures, it is also heavily armed.

enemy_1189_krgaxe.name: Icefield Warrior
enemy_1189_krgaxe.description: A warrior proficient in icefield combat. Long periods of living on the icefields have tempered their will and physique.

enemy_1189_krgaxe_2.name: Icefield Warrior Leader
enemy_1189_krgaxe_2.description: An elite warrior proficient in icefield combat. Their will and physique are as unbreakable as solid ice on the snow-capped mountains.

enemy_1190_krgbow.name: Icefield Hunter
enemy_1190_krgbow.description: A hunter living on the icefields. Creatures on the icefields often form groups, and the hunters have become skilled at finding the weakest link in a group of prey.
enemy_1190_krgbow.ability: Prioritizes attacking the target with the <@eb.key>lowest DEF</>

enemy_1190_krgbow_2.name: Icefield Hunter Leader
enemy_1190_krgbow_2.description: A seasoned hunter living on the icefields. After finding the weakest link in a group of prey, they will hound it relentlessly until one of them falls dead.
enemy_1190_krgbow_2.ability: Prioritizes attacking the target with the <@eb.key>lowest DEF</>

enemy_1191_krgrg.name: Icefield Arts Fighter
enemy_1191_krgrg.description: A special warrior born in a harsh environment. While they mainly use Arts in combat, their bodies are simply another one of their weapons. They are at their most dangerous when they fall in battle.
enemy_1191_krgrg.ability: Attacks deal <@eb.key>Arts damage</>; Upon death, deals <@eb.key>Arts damage</> to all surrounding units and inflicts <$ba.cold>Cold</>; Loses HP when shifted.

enemy_1191_krgrg_2.name: Icefield Arts Guard
enemy_1191_krgrg_2.description: A special warrior born in a harsh environment. As they gain insight into their Arts, they become more skilled at utilizing every last bit of their power. They are extremely dangerous when they fall in battle.
enemy_1191_krgrg_2.ability: Attacks deal <@eb.key>Arts damage</>; Upon death, deals <@eb.key>Arts damage</> to all surrounding units and inflicts <$ba.cold>Cold</>; Loses HP when shifted.

enemy_1192_krgscr.name: Icefield Caster
enemy_1192_krgscr.description: A caster who has secluded themselves in the mountains to research Arts techniques. By integrating the frost of the icefields into their Arts, they have gained new enlightenment.
enemy_1192_krgscr.ability: Attacks two targets at once; After two attacks, the next attack inflicts <$ba.cold>Cold</>; Gains <$ba.buffres>status resistance</>

enemy_1192_krgscr_2.name: Icefield Caster Leader
enemy_1192_krgscr_2.description: A caster who has secluded themselves in the mountains to research Arts techniques. The frost has become a part of their Arts, or rather their Arts have become a part of the icefields.
enemy_1192_krgscr_2.ability: Attacks two targets at once; After two attacks, the next attack inflicts <$ba.cold>Cold</>; Gains <$ba.buffres>status resistance</>

enemy_1193_krgbsk.name: Icefield Berserker
enemy_1193_krgbsk.description: A berserker of the icefields. The blistering cold brings them joy, and glacial winds do naught but excite them. An environment that their enemies would consider harsh is nothing out of the ordinary to them.
enemy_1193_krgbsk.ability: A berserker of the icefields, Attack power increases when attacking <$ba.frozen>Frozen</> targets; Gains <$ba.buffres>status resistance</>

enemy_1193_krgbsk_2.name: Icefield Berserker Leader
enemy_1193_krgbsk_2.description: A berserker of the icefields. The blistering cold brings them joy, and glacial winds do naught but excite them. To be able to fell their enemies in the tempestuous snow is their greatest bliss.
enemy_1193_krgbsk_2.ability: A berserker of the icefields, Attack power greatly increases when attacking <$ba.frozen>Frozen</> targets; Gains <$ba.buffres>status resistance</>

enemy_1194_krgmtr.name: Tschäggättä
enemy_1194_krgmtr.description: A special ops squad secretly formed in Victoria by SilverAsh, based on the Kjerag folk legend 'Tschäggättä' used to hush crying children. They are able to resist brutally cold temperatures, and are extremely proficient in mountainous combat.
enemy_1194_krgmtr.ability: Gains <$ba.buffres>status resistance</>; ATK increases during snowfall, attacks <@eb.key>decrease the target's DEF</>

enemy_1194_krgmtr_2.name: Tschäggättä Leader
enemy_1194_krgmtr_2.description: A special ops squad secretly formed in Victoria by SilverAsh, based on the Kjerag folk legend 'Tschäggättä' used to hush crying children. They are able to resist brutally cold temperatures, and are extremely proficient in mountainous combat. As squad leaders, they are truly the elite among the elite.
enemy_1194_krgmtr_2.ability: Gains <$ba.buffres>status resistance</>; ATK increases during snowfall, attacks <@eb.key>decrease the target's DEF</>

enemy_1195_sfyin.name: Grindstone
enemy_1195_sfyin.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. All blades must be sharpened to not lose their edge. A Waregeist of this type tends to be timid and will dash out of harm's way at the first sign of danger.

enemy_1195_sfyin_2.name: Brightmirror
enemy_1195_sfyin_2.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. All blades must be sharpened to not lose their edge. A Waregeist of this type tends to be timid, but often goes the extra mile in an attempt to prove itself.

enemy_1196_msfyin.name: Wooden Seal
enemy_1196_msfyin.description: The original form of 'Grindstone.' Made of modest materials.
enemy_1196_msfyin.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>2</> times to defeat.

enemy_1196_msfyin_2.name: Rosewood Seal
enemy_1196_msfyin_2.description: The original form of 'Brightmirror.' Made of durable materials and adorned with elegant patterns.
enemy_1196_msfyin_2.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>3</> times to defeat.

enemy_1197_sfshu.name: Vernacularism
enemy_1197_sfshu.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. The world is a strange place, but there is joy to be had. A Waregeist of this type is unusually energetic and likes to hang out with other Waregeists.

enemy_1197_sfshu_2.name: Sophistication
enemy_1197_sfshu_2.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. Among its serene mountains and waterscapes, one can be free and enjoy themselves without a care in the world. A Waregeist of this type is quiet and refined, bringing joy to other Waregeists.

enemy_1198_msfshu.name: Novel Scroll
enemy_1198_msfshu.description: The original form of 'Vernacularism.' An written account of the world's wondrous happenings.
enemy_1198_msfshu.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>3</> times to defeat.

enemy_1198_msfshu_2.name: Painting Scroll
enemy_1198_msfshu_2.description: The original form of 'Sophistication.' An illustration of the mountainscapes and spring snow.
enemy_1198_msfshu_2.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>4</> times to defeat.

enemy_1199_sfjin.name: Introspection
enemy_1199_sfjin.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. Beauty is in the eye of the beholder. A Waregeist of this type can show its opponent their inner secrets, and is more likely to anger its opponents than other Waregeists.
enemy_1199_sfjin.ability: More likely to be attacked by allied units; Spawns <@eb.key>1</> [Bronze Mirrors] when defeated.

enemy_1199_sfjin_2.name: Scantwords
enemy_1199_sfjin_2.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. Beauty is in the eye of the beholder. A Waregeist of this type can show its opponent their inner secrets in their most relentless, truest form, and is more likely to anger its opponents than other Waregeists.
enemy_1199_sfjin_2.ability: More likely to be attacked by allied units; Spawns <@eb.key>1</> [Brass Mirrors] when defeated.

enemy_1200_msfjin.name: Bronze Mirror
enemy_1200_msfjin.description: The original form of 'Introspection.' Has a simple, unembellished design.
enemy_1200_msfjin.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>30</> times to defeat.

enemy_1200_msfjin_2.name: Brass Mirror
enemy_1200_msfjin_2.description: The original form of 'Scantwords.' Has a crystal-clear reflective surface and an elegant design.
enemy_1200_msfjin_2.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>35</> times to defeat.

enemy_1201_sfzhi.name: Inkwave
enemy_1201_sfzhi.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. It is always difficult to put brush to paper, and though the paperweight was once calm and patient, it is now anxious and restless.

enemy_1201_sfzhi_2.name: Heartbillow
enemy_1201_sfzhi_2.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. The crouching demon and sleeping dragon solemnly stand guard and ward off evil, and though the paperweight was once stately and majestic, it is now anxious and restless, always ready to attack.

enemy_1202_msfzhi.name: Wooden Paperweight
enemy_1202_msfzhi.description: The original form of 'Inkwave.' Made of modest materials.
enemy_1202_msfzhi.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>3</> times to defeat.

enemy_1202_msfzhi_2.name: Rosewood Paperweight
enemy_1202_msfzhi_2.description: The original form of 'Heartbillow.' Made of fine, durable materials with an antiquated aesthetic.
enemy_1202_msfzhi_2.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>4</> times to defeat.

enemy_1203_sfhu.name: Fountainboil
enemy_1203_sfhu.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. When the water comes to a boil, spreading its fragrance far and wide, none can resist partaking in a cup of tea. A Waregeist of this type can paralyze its foes and slow their attacks.
enemy_1203_sfhu.ability: Deals area <@eb.key>Arts damage</>, <@eb.key>greatly reducing allied units' ASPD</> (can be <$ba.buffres>resisted</>), and spawns <@eb.key>4</> [Celadon Teawares] when defeated.

enemy_1203_sfhu_2.name: Rainbowbrew
enemy_1203_sfhu_2.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. Adding water to wine gets you a less potent drink, while adding water to tea creates a richer beverage. A Waregeist of this type can paralyze its foes and slow their attacks. It is tireless, fighting more gallantly by the minute.
enemy_1203_sfhu_2.ability: Deals area <@eb.key>Arts damage</>, <@eb.key>greatly reducing allied units' ASPD</> (can be <$ba.buffres>resisted</>), and spawns <@eb.key>4</> [Porcelain Teawares] when defeated.

enemy_1204_msfhu.name: Celadon Teaware
enemy_1204_msfhu.description: The original form of 'Fountainboil.' The celadon is fine and exquisite, and its shape simple yet refined.
enemy_1204_msfhu.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>4</> times by <@eb.key>Arts or True</> damage to defeat.

enemy_1204_msfhu_2.name: Porcelain Teaware
enemy_1204_msfhu_2.description: The original form of 'Rainbowbrew.' Bright in color, its shape is elegant and solid.
enemy_1204_msfhu_2.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>6</> times by <@eb.key>Arts or True</> damage to defeat.

enemy_1205_sfpin.name: Blueflower
enemy_1205_sfpin.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. Crystalline and adorned with engravings of dragons and phoenixes, a Waregeist of this type is graceful and sophisticated, though it's hard to say whether that goes for its temperament too.
enemy_1205_sfpin.ability: After several attacks, inflicts continuous <@eb.key>Arts damage that slowly increases over time</> (can be <$ba.buffres>resisted</>), and spawns <@eb.key>1</> [Celadon Vase] when defeated.

enemy_1205_sfpin_2.name: Scarletmist
enemy_1205_sfpin_2.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. Crystalline and adorned with engravings of dragons and phoenixes, a Waregeist of this type is mysterious and imposing in nature, though it is also extremely irritable in temperament and very aggressive.
enemy_1205_sfpin_2.ability: After several attacks, inflicts continuous <@eb.key>Arts damage that slowly increases over time</> (can be <$ba.buffres>resisted</>), and spawns <@eb.key>1</> [Porcelain Vase] when defeated.

enemy_1206_msfpin.name: Celadon Vase
enemy_1206_msfpin.description: The original form of 'Blueflower.' The celadon is fine and exquisite, and its shape simple yet refined.
enemy_1206_msfpin.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>12</> times by <@eb.key>Arts or True</> damage to defeat.

enemy_1206_msfpin_2.name: Porcelain Vase
enemy_1206_msfpin_2.description: The original form of 'Scarletmist.' Bright in color, its shape is elegant and solid.
enemy_1206_msfpin_2.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>15</> times by <@eb.key>Arts or True</> damage to defeat.

enemy_1207_sfji.name: Sinkingsand
enemy_1207_sfji.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. The weaponry dreams of the past, brooding on its utter defeat. A Waregeist of this type holds deep, bottomless grudges, and can be particularly destructive.
enemy_1207_sfji.ability: Consume [Broken Blades] to gain increased ATK; When defeated, each unconsumed [Broken Blade] will spawn a [Bronze Spearhead] (at least <@eb.key>1</>).

enemy_1207_sfji_2.name: Sharpedge
enemy_1207_sfji_2.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. The weaponry yet again dreams of the past. A Waregeist of this type rouses its old memories as though it is taking to the battlefield again. Its strength is doubled as it and its peers rally each other.
enemy_1207_sfji_2.ability: Consume [Broken Blades] to gain increased ATK; When defeated, each unconsumed [Broken Blade] will spawn a [Iron Spearhead] (at least <@eb.key>1</>).

enemy_1208_msfji.name: Bronze Spearhead
enemy_1208_msfji.description: The original form of 'Sinkingsand.' Its surface is severely rusted.
enemy_1208_msfji.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>25</> times to defeat.

enemy_1208_msfji_2.name: Iron Spearhead
enemy_1208_msfji_2.description: The original form of 'Sharpedge.' Although rusted, it is nonetheless an instrument of death. Even though the Waregeist has faded, the killing intent yet lingers.
enemy_1208_msfji_2.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>30</> times to defeat.

enemy_1209_sfden.name: Clarity
enemy_1209_sfden.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. Its tiny glimmer can flood its surroundings with light. Other Waregeists are invisible under its radiance, as though shrouded by its blessings.
enemy_1209_sfden.ability: Periodically grants temporary <$ba.invisible>Invisibility</> to surrounding enemy units and spawns <@eb.key>1</> [Bronze Lampstand] when defeated.

enemy_1209_sfden_2.name: Magnificence
enemy_1209_sfden_2.description: A Waregeist that manifested when it was infected by Sui-Xiang. Its tiny glimmer serves as a beacon casting light upon the dark night. A Waregeist of this type not only blesses its peers with its radiance, but is also particularly destructive.
enemy_1209_sfden_2.ability: Periodically grants temporary <$ba.invisible>Invisibility</> to surrounding enemy units and spawns <@eb.key>1</> [Iron Lampstand] when defeated.

enemy_1210_msfden.name: Bronze Lampstand
enemy_1210_msfden.description: The original form of 'Clarity.' Its surface is severely rusted.
enemy_1210_msfden.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>35</> times to defeat.

enemy_1210_msfden_2.name: Iron Lampstand
enemy_1210_msfden_2.description: The original form of 'Magnificence.' A thick layer of wax remains inside.
enemy_1210_msfden_2.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>45</> times to defeat.

enemy_1211_msfsui.name: Wisp
enemy_1211_msfsui.description: An everlasting will-o'-the-wisp shed from Sui-Xiang's body.
enemy_1211_msfsui.ability: Cannot be blocked; Must be damaged <@eb.key>10</> times to defeat; After coming into contact with Sui-Xiang's [Dantian], grants it increased Starting HP; After entering Sui-Xiang's Stage 3 form, grants SP to its [Omnidirectional Breath].

enemy_1212_mtrfol.name: Pathfinder Legionarius
enemy_1212_mtrfol.description: A warrior who has flocked to the Guide, inspired by his philosophy. Fights to bring the common goal of the Pathfinders to fruition.

enemy_1212_mtrfol_2.name: Pathfinder Legionarius Prefect
enemy_1212_mtrfol_2.description: A powerful warrior who has flocked to the Guide, inspired by his philosophy. Fights to bring the common goal of the Pathfinders to fruition.

enemy_1213_mtrsnp.name: Pathfinder Sagittarius
enemy_1213_mtrsnp.description: A warrior proficient at using guns in long-range combat. Their attacks are precise, and especially deadly when loaded with special ammunition.
enemy_1213_mtrsnp.ability: While this unit is holding Ammo, ATK increases. Ammo capacity: <@eb.key>1</>

enemy_1213_mtrsnp_2.name: Pathfinder Sagittarius Prefect
enemy_1213_mtrsnp_2.description: An elite warrior proficient at using guns in long-range combat. Their attacks are precise, and especially deadly when loaded with special ammunition.
enemy_1213_mtrsnp_2.ability: While this unit is holding Ammo, ATK increases. Ammo capacity: <@eb.key>1</>

enemy_1214_mtrmgc.name: Pathfinder Artifex
enemy_1214_mtrmgc.description: A caster employing unusual Originium Arts. Able to extract energy from special Arts Units to inflict tremendous devastation.
enemy_1214_mtrmgc.ability: While this unit is holding Ammo, attacks inflict <$ba.dt.burning>Burn Damage</>. Ammo capacity: <@eb.key>1</>

enemy_1214_mtrmgc_2.name: Pathfinder Artifex Prefect
enemy_1214_mtrmgc_2.description: A caster employing unusual Originium Arts. Able to extract energy from special Arts Units to inflict horrific devastation.
enemy_1214_mtrmgc_2.ability: While this unit is holding Ammo, attacks inflict <$ba.dt.burning>Burn Damage</>. Ammo capacity: <@eb.key>1</>

enemy_1215_ptrarc.name: Pathfinder Veles
enemy_1215_ptrarc.description: A warrior who specializes in dropping into battle from the skies. They take greater pleasure from seeing their foes flustered by the loss of their supplies than actually defeating them.
enemy_1215_ptrarc.ability: Prioritizes attacking 'Gelato Stops'. Deals additional Arts Damage to 'Gelato Stops'.

enemy_1215_ptrarc_2.name: Pathfinder Veles Prefect
enemy_1215_ptrarc_2.description: An elite warrior who specializes in dropping into battle from the skies. In addition to defeating their enemies, they will also destroy their supplies in the blink of an eye, blowing the battle wide open.
enemy_1215_ptrarc_2.ability: Prioritizes attacking 'Gelato Stops'. Deals additional Arts Damage to 'Gelato Stops'.

enemy_1216_cansld.name: Pathfinder Ballistarius
enemy_1216_cansld.description: A stalwart warrior who stands on the front lines, firing shells capable of inflicting widespread destruction. By virtue of their physique, they can withstand the recoil from their cannons, as well as hold their own in close combat even without their weapons. Extremely reliable.
enemy_1216_cansld.ability: While this unit is holding Ammo, attacks become long-ranged and deal Splash Damage. Deals additional Arts Damage to 'Gelato Stops'. Ammo capacity: <@eb.key>2</>

enemy_1216_cansld_2.name: Pathfinder Ballistarius Prefect
enemy_1216_cansld_2.description: A stalwart warrior who rushes forward on the front lines, firing shells capable of inflicting widespread destruction. By virtue of their physique, they can withstand the recoil from their cannons, and are proficient in close combat even without their weapons. Extremely reliable.
enemy_1216_cansld_2.ability: While this unit is holding Ammo, attacks become long-ranged and deal Splash Damage. Deals additional Arts Damage to 'Gelato Stops'. Ammo capacity: <@eb.key>2</>

enemy_1217_rescar.name: Pathfinder Dessert Vendor
enemy_1217_rescar.description: Seems to be an ordinary street vendor. However, their carts are likely loaded with more than just snacks. Anger them at your own peril.
enemy_1217_rescar.ability: While this unit is holding Ammo, summons a [Snack Cart] periodically. Deals significantly increased damage to enemies blocking this unit. Ammo capacity: <@eb.key>3</>

enemy_1217_rescar_2.name: Renowned Pathfinder Dessert Vendor
enemy_1217_rescar_2.description: Seems to be an ordinary street vendor. However, their carts are likely loaded with more than just snacks. Those who anger them will soon learn the true meaning of fear.
