enemy_2035_sybox.name: Chest Seaborn
enemy_2035_sybox.description: Sea Terror disguised as a treasure chest, often used by Bishops of the Deep to protect hideouts.

enemy_4001_toxcar.name: Retrofitted Gastruck
enemy_4001_toxcar.description: A pesticide spraying vehicle that used to belong to a large nomadic city. It has been retrofitted by Closure to spray tear gas instead, but she didn't have time to install an IFF system.
enemy_4001_toxcar.ability: When unblocked, all allied units lose HP constantly

enemy_4001_toxcar_2.name: Supercharged Gastruck
enemy_4001_toxcar_2.description: A pesticide spraying vehicle that used to belong to a large nomadic city. It has been retrofitted by Closure to spray tear gas instead, but she didn't have time to install an IFF system. This model has an expanded gas tank and is far more dangerous.
enemy_4001_toxcar_2.ability: When unblocked, all allied units lose HP constantly

enemy_4002_syokai.name: Cheap Second-hand Drone
enemy_4002_syokai.description: Cheap goods sold for scrap from the Kazimierz arenas. Feel free to waste it however you like.
enemy_4002_syokai.ability: When destroyed, grants a deployable unit; Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter.

enemy_4002_syokai_2.name: Remodeled Second-hand Drone
enemy_4002_syokai_2.description: Cheap goods sold for scrap from the Kazimierz arenas. Closure has performed some slight modifications on this batch, but it won't change the fact these are cheap as hell.
enemy_4002_syokai_2.ability: When destroyed, grants a deployable unit; Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter.

enemy_4003_pbank.name: Mobile Power Source
enemy_4003_pbank.description: An experimental prototype developed during the early years of a certain Columbian tech company. The objective was to provide power on the battlefield, however due to the lack of a positioning device, it will often leave by itself if unattended to.
enemy_4003_pbank.ability: Cannot be blocked; When destroyed, recovers the SP of nearby Operators; Does not count towards the defeated enemies counter.

enemy_1050_lslime.name: 'Pompeii'
enemy_1050_lslime.description: A massive infected beast. These aberrations were born in a special high-temperature environment. Nobody wants to approach these creatures due to their grotesque appearance and the extreme heat they give off. The existence of these giant creatures has been known since ancient times, but to see one warped by infection is terrifyingly unforgettable...
enemy_1050_lslime.ability: Attacks up to four targets simultaneously; Ignites targets it attacks, dealing burn damage over time; When blocked, self-immolates to cause high damage; Gains a large amount of ASPD when this unit's HP is under 50%.

enemy_1500_skulsr.name: Skullshatterer
enemy_1500_skulsr.description: One of Reunion's squad leaders who serves in the Assault Squad. Though armed with an Originium launcher and explosives, reports show that he possesses high mobility and poses a significant threat even in melee combat.He has been seen several times around Lungmen, and intel suggests that he is carrying out some special operation in the region.
enemy_1500_skulsr.ability: Launches grenades when not being blocked, reducing the DEF of the primary target and surrounding allied Operators significantly; Increases ATK significantly when HP is under 50%.

enemy_1502_crowns.name: Crownslayer
enemy_1502_crowns.description: One of Reunion's squad leaders who handles infiltration and assassination operations, specializing in melee combat and breaking through defensive lines. Her stealth and superb infiltration abilities have foiled countless attempts to capture her.
enemy_1502_crowns.ability: Can pass through Operators if blocked.

enemy_1503_talula.name: Talulah
enemy_1503_talula.description: The leader and spokesperson of Reunion. So far, she has been confirmed to have masterminded multiple riots, as well as the destruction of Chernobog.
enemy_1503_talula.ability: Long-ranged attacks and [Stellar Corona] deal Arts damage; When blocked, uses melee attacks that deal True damage; Applies [Burning Breath] to one target (Deals increasing True damage each second, but can be <$ba.buffres>resisted</>); When HP drops beneath half, gains greatly increased DEF and RES, and uses Skills more often.

enemy_1504_cqbw.name: W
enemy_1504_cqbw.description: A Sarkaz Mercenary and one of Reunion's squad leaders, she carries around a weapon that resembles a Laterano Gun. However, she almost exclusively attacks using explosives and throwing weapons. One of her common strategies is to attack the enemy's flank using large amounts of active Originium explosives. However, her erratic movements make her almost impossible to predict...
enemy_1504_cqbw.ability: Can use explosives to deal massive physical damage;

enemy_1505_frstar.name: FrostNova
enemy_1505_frstar.description: A Caster who is one of Reunion's squad leaders. She is one of the few Casters capable of suppressing enemies in a head-on engagement. Among the squads she leads, the special 'Yeti Squadron' assists her in some special operations. As her name implies, she has a cold personality.
enemy_1505_frstar.ability: Frequently uses Arts to attack nearby Operators with an Ice Nova, dealing high Arts damage as well as slowing the AS of affected targets; Can also Freeze tiles indefinitely, making it impossible to deploy Operators on these tiles.

enemy_1507_mephi.name: Mephisto
enemy_1507_mephi.description: A Medic who is one of Reunion's squad leaders, often working in tandem with Faust. He heals the wounded while commanding his troops to attack, and can improve their life recovery rate. He boasts a high resistance to Arts. Currently, it has been confirmed that he is the one controlling the Hosts.
enemy_1507_mephi.ability: Doubles the HP regeneration of all enemies on the field; Normal attack heals 3 enemy units at a time.

enemy_1508_faust.name: Faust
enemy_1508_faust.description: A Sniper who is one of Reunion's squad leaders, often working in tandem with Mephisto. He uses extremely long-range attacks to inflict devastating physical damage. He is known to occasionally use special attacks such as summoning turret-like ballistae or launching highly destructive bolts.
enemy_1508_faust.ability: Cannot be blocked and gains invulnerability for a period of time; May attack with a special bolt dealing double damage; Regularly activates hidden turrets around the battlefield.

enemy_1509_mousek.name: 'Rat King'
enemy_1509_mousek.description: Lin, Lin Gray, the Rat King of the slum. He bears many titles, just like the shifting of the city's shadows underneath his feet. Don't touch the red lines. If you ever have a moment of indecisiveness, whatever it is that you were concerned about will become nothing more than a whisper in the winds above the dunes.
enemy_1509_mousek.ability: Greatly increased DEF when the shield is present; targets the unit with the highest Max HP with 'Singing Sands', inflicting massive Physical damage; targets the unit with the lowest Max HP with 'Sand Tomb', reducing the target's ATK and continuously inflicting Arts damage.

enemy_1510_frstar2.name: FrostNova, 'Winter's Scar'
enemy_1510_frstar2.description: Leader of the Yeti Squadron, she has released the remainder of what little life force she has left in preparation for the final battle. The biting cold of the land has already been released; are we truly prepared to make an enemy out of it?
enemy_1510_frstar2.ability: Normal attacks and Ice Novas inflict Arts damage and cause the <$ba.cold>Cold</> effect on affected targets; Ice Nova deals double damage to <$ba.frozen>Frozen</> targets; FrostNova is temporarily invulnerable during her second form, and her attacks and skills are more powerful

enemy_1506_patrt.name: Patriot
enemy_1506_patrt.description: His armor is in disrepair and damaged in many places. The blade of his once sharp halberd is now eroded with rust. However, the indomitable Patriot never capitulates, never backs down, and never shows mercy. He has long struggled with fate, and now resolves to slit the throat of fate.
enemy_1506_patrt.ability: Inspires his troops, greatly increasing their ATK and DEF; In Marching stance, he is extremely vulnerable to attacks; In Ruination stance, he uses long-ranged attacks, is immune to <$ba.stun>Stun</> effects, continuously deals True damage around him, and deals Physical damage to the farthest high ground unit.

enemy_1511_mdrock.name: Mudrock
enemy_1511_mdrock.description: Age unknown, gender unknown, history unknown. This ex-Reunion member now leads an organization of Infected and wanders the wilderness between the cities of Leithanien. What thoughts run through Mudrock's mind as being forced to once again step upon the battlefield?
enemy_1511_mdrock.ability: When attacking, permanently increases ATK, stacking up to 6 times; Has a barrier that absorbs spell damage; While the barrier persists, this unit has greatly increased Max HP and ASPD; Barrier periodically refreshes; Releases a skill that automatically seizes control of the nearest non-enemy controlled 'Gramophone.'

enemy_1512_mcmstr.name: 'The Big Ugly Thing'
enemy_1512_mcmstr.description: Zumama's magnum opus, a massive mechanical monster piloted by the High Priest. It can strike both in melee range and from a distance, capable of easily destroying Giant Mushrooms and Stumps. Normal engineers cannot even fathom how a machine slapped together haphazardly like this can even move, but move it indeed does.
enemy_1512_mcmstr.ability: Periodically destroys Giant Mushrooms and Stumps, rendering them unable to be deployed upon; After this unit's HP drops to 0, it will explode, <$ba.stun>Stunning</> units in a large area and ejecting its pilot, the 'High Priest.'

enemy_1513_dekght.name: Corrupted Knight
enemy_1513_dekght.description: A Sarkaz knight with a broken horn who radiates terror and shows clear signs of excessive drug use. Uses a warhammer in battle. Crushes enemies with terrifying bloodlust. When the Withered Knight falls, takes up the quest and becomes dramatically stronger. Every step he takes spreads corruption.
enemy_1513_dekght.ability: Deals physical damage to its target and four surrounding tiles when attacking. Growth attack deals high physical damage to its target and four surrounding tiles. When the Withered Knight dies, ATK, ASPD, and movement speed are significantly increased.

enemy_1513_dekght_2.name: Withered Knight
enemy_1513_dekght_2.description: A Sarkaz knight with a broken horn who radiates terror and shows clear signs of excessive drug use. Uses a cursed bow in battle. Can shoot multiple targets at once and plant seeds of withering arts. When the Corrupted Knight falls, takes up the quest and becomes dramatically stronger. Knights that are hostile to him will shift to Wither.
enemy_1513_dekght_2.ability: Attacks two targets simultaneously. Fires explosive arrows at three targets, which explode after a short delay, dealing high Arts damage to the target and surrounding four tiles. When the Corrupted Knight dies, ATK, ASPD, and movement speed are significantly increased.

enemy_1514_smephi.name: Mephisto, 'The Singer'
enemy_1514_smephi.description: You seem to recognize the mysterious, mythical beast that has descended from the Sarcophagus. An otherworldly song flows from its sharp beak and floods its surroundings. It seems to devour the will of the Infected around it, including its own. Even if it knows not what it is doing, its song does not cease. It simply wishes to sing.
enemy_1514_smephi.ability: When Activated, heals and strengthens an enemy Host unit; Each time a certain percentage of HP is lost, releases a toxic cloud across the entire battlefield that lasts for 30s and can stack. When HP drops to 0 for the first time, enters a dormant state for a period of time, then gains DEF, RES, and HP regeneration.

enemy_1515_bsnake.name: 'The Deathless Black Snake'
enemy_1515_bsnake.description: A disenchanted Reunion soldier, or a giant manipulating history? A conspirator full of lies, or a nobleman swallowed by tragedy? The truth has been turned to ash, and only an evil god stands in the flames.
enemy_1515_bsnake.ability: Attacks deal True damage and apply [Burning Breath] to the target (Deals increasing True damage each second, but can be <$ba.buffres>resisted</>); Takes greatly reduced damage from targets afflicted by [Burning Breath]; Applies [Burning Breath] to two of your units; Detonates all units on the battlefield afflicted by [Burning Breath], dealing Arts damage to the surrounding four tiles and applying [Burning Breath] to targets hit by this splash effect. When HP drops to 0, releases [Deathless Inferno], dealing massive Arts damage across the battlefield; When Enraged, gains greatly increased HP and ATK and summons [Energy Aggregates] to assist in battle.

enemy_1516_jakill.name: Jesselton Miller
enemy_1516_jakill.description: Jesselton Miller, a killer who infiltrated the prison disguised as a jailer. Very particular in both speech and action, he remains graceful even in the midst of battle.
enemy_1516_jakill.ability: In Jailer form, he has greatly increased RES, uses long-ranged Arts attacks, can <$ba.stun>Stun</> multiple targets, and does not attack Imprisonment Devices; In Killer form, he has greatly increased DEF, uses melee Physical attacks, and ignores a certain amount of the target's DEF; When changing to Killer form, immediately frees all other enemies

enemy_1517_xi.name: 'Free'
enemy_1517_xi.description: A monster drawn by Dusk. It has a commanding presence and chilling arrogance, as though taking a page out of its master's book. 'The virid beasts. Like range on range. Eleven told. In moon, smoke-flow.'
enemy_1517_xi.ability: 'Weft and Warp' deals Arts damage to enemies in the surrounding cross area, changing Hui-Ming attributes within its range; 'Break the Chains': If the shield is not yet broken, deal massive ranged damage; During second phase, attacks twice and additionally unleashes 'Weft and Warp' on farthest target.

enemy_1519_bgball.name: 'Essence of Evolution'
enemy_1519_bgball.description: A madman who should not have stepped upon this world. An oddity that should not have existed in the other world. The union of the two gave birth to this node of 'evolution' that far surpasses the limits of biology. It's existence naturally contradicts all of Terra. It should not live. It must not live.
enemy_1519_bgball.ability: Unable to move; Will evolve after a certain duration or when HP falls below a certain threshold; Periodically creates <Originiutant Excrescence> or <Originiutant Tumor>; Periodically deals a large amount of True damage to all deployed Operators; During [Newborn Form], greatly reduce Physical and Arts damage taken from units to the left; During [Evolution Form], greatly reduce Physical and Arts damage taken from units to the right; During [Perfect Form], massively reduce Physical and Arts damage taken, however lose HP every second

enemy_1520_empgrd.name: 'Emperor's Blade', Pursuer
enemy_1520_empgrd.description: He once ravaged the demons of the Northern Tundra, segregating the outsiders beyond the reach of civilization; His blade shies not from royals nor nobles, safeguarding glory from the dusts of rebellion. Every Royal Guard is as a dominion; the land beneath their feet is all the territory of Ursus.
enemy_1520_empgrd.ability: Whenever a certain percentage of HP is lost, unleashes the permanent terrain effect [Dominion], significantly reducing allied units' ASPD and reducing Physical and Arts damage taken by self when within its effect (Prioritizes targeting the ally unit outside of [Dominion] with the highest damage dealt to self); Casts [Collapsing Fear] which deals Arts damage to nearby units, instantly defeating the target if they are within [Dominion]; The first time HP drops to 0, casts [Collapsing Fear] on the entire battlefield; During his second form, his attacks and skills are more powerful

enemy_1521_dslily.name: Sal Viento Bishop Quintus
enemy_1521_dslily.description: A member of the Church of the Deep who snuck into disaster-ravaged Iberia. He changed the law of the land through his sincere beliefs, in pursuit of the perfect form, yet he was unable to fathom the will of the ocean. Then again, who could?
enemy_1521_dslily.ability: Attacks two targets with the highest DEF simultaneously; [Great Tide] deals Arts damage and <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</> to all allied units; [Collapse] deals Physical damage to multiple allied units; [Fragmentation] summons its offspring to entwine themselves around allied units and <$ba.stun>Stun</> them; [Species Outbreak] removes all Life Points when a long time has passed in the battle.

enemy_1522_captan.name: Pancho Salas
enemy_1522_captan.description: Pancho Salas, an old veteran piloting a heavily modified motorboat. Even should his vessel be destroyed, he will never falter before reaching his goal.
enemy_1522_captan.ability: Summons 'Kite' to fight alongside explosive boats; attacks the unit with the highest Max HP with its water cannon and continuously deals Arts and <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</>. During second phase, periodically attacks all surrounding units; attacks the unit with the highest DEF with its small arms and reduces the unit's DEF. When it defeats a unit or when it is defeated, increases the ATK and Movement Speed of all enemy units.

enemy_1523_mandra.name: Mandragora
enemy_1523_mandra.description: One of the leaders of the Dublinn forces, a caster who controls stone. Emerging from the darkness of Victoria, she has sworn to repay the humiliation she suffered at the hands of the nobles manyfold.
enemy_1523_mandra.ability: [Stoneshield] Reduces damage taken, temporarily loses effect after being hit by a <@eb.key>Tattered Pillar</>; [Mandragora's Gaze] Targets the unit with the highest ATK within range, dealing Arts damage and reducing their ASPD. If the target is retreated or defeated, destroy the tile the unit was on; In her second form, [Stoneshield] also grants <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>, and Mandragora becomes able to knock down <@eb.key>Tattered Pillars</>

enemy_1524_bldkgt.name: The Blood Knight Dikaiopolis
enemy_1524_bldkgt.description: The Blood Knight, Dikaiopolis. The originator of Kazimierz's Infected Knight program, the hero of the Grand Knight Territory's Infected, and an idol to countless children. What exactly did the 'hero' give up to obtain the peace we know today?
enemy_1524_bldkgt.ability: Reduce damage taken, however this effect is ineffective against the unit blocking self; 'Exsanguination': Stun the target and deal Arts damage every second; After the HP of his first form drops to 0, enters 'Resurrection Stance'. During this period, the Blood Knight is invulnerable and continuously summons Bloodblades, and enters the second form after some time. If the Blood Knight's HP is restored to its maximum while in 'Resurrection Stance', he will return to his first form; During his second form, he has increased ATK, uses ranged attacks, and continuously summons Bloodblades.

enemy_1525_blkswb.name: Degenbrecher
enemy_1525_blkswb.description: Three-time champion of the Kazimierz Major, a defective Leithanian unable to use Arts, a natural-born warrior—The Black Knight.
enemy_1525_blkswb.ability: Immune to <$ba.frozen>Frozen</> and gains <$ba.buffres>status resistance</>; ATK increases during snowfall and, when blocked, attacks against the blocker ignore a certain amount of DEF; [Swift Slayer] When blocked, bypasses the target and deals Physical damage to units along the path; [Brutalizing Blizzard] Deals Physical damage to units in the surrounding area; During her second form, gain <$ba.invisible>Invisibility</>, attacks ignore more DEF and deal damage twice, [Momentum Murder] Whenever 25% HP is lost, clears the SP of all allied units in range and prevent the targets from attacking or healing for some time.

enemy_1526_sfsui.name: 'Sui-Xiang'
enemy_1526_sfsui.description: The shadow of the bestial Sui, towering and venerable. It casts its lazy gaze upon the mortal realm, and in the blink of an eye a thousand years have come and gone. With the millennium passing like a dream, it is uncertain whether it is feeling anger or bitterness.
enemy_1526_sfsui.ability: Reduces damage taken from above and below; When defeated during its Stage 1 or 2 form, after a period of time, the unit takes its next form and reappears a certain distance to the right; [Faraway Mountains' Thunderclap] Deals continuous Arts damage to units within cross areas around three ranged units; [Heavensfall] Deals Physical damage twice to melee units and additionally inflicts continuous Arts damage that slowly increases over time (can be <$ba.buffres>resisted</>); [Omnidirectional Breath] Inflicts continuous damage to a large area to the right and renders the tiles no longer available for deployment; Operators in the left side of the target area can reduce damage taken by allied units to the right and mitigate damage to the tiles.

enemy_1527_martyr.name: Andoain, the 'Martyr'
enemy_1527_martyr.description: A Sankta who made an enemy of Laterano for the sake of asking a question. A Pathfinder who tread the path of peril for the sake of receiving an answer. He feels neither wrath nor sorrow. He neither curses God, nor beseeches man. Andoain only follows his own path, wherever it may end.
enemy_1527_martyr.ability: Cannot be blocked. While holding Ammo, this unit gains increased ATK, and attacks will cause Ammo to bounce to a nearby target, up to a maximum of <@eb.key>5</> bounces, dealing additional damage to 'Gelato Stops'. Ammo capacity: <@eb.key>5</>; After losing a certain percentage of HP, creates a permanent field effect, 'Light Unto Sufferers'. Enemies standing on 'Light Unto Sufferers' take reduced Physical and Arts Damage and gain 50% Physical and Arts Dodge. After being defeated once, enters his Second Form, gaining increased ATK and periodically using 'Ashes to Ashes, Dust to Dust': Andoain stops attacking and scans the battlefield from left to right, locking onto at most 5 targets before dealing massive Physical Damage to them and fully replenishing his Ammo.

enemy_1528_manfri.name: Manfred
enemy_1528_manfri.description: A young Sarkaz general, member of the Military Commission of Kazdel. After enlisting a large number of mercenaries in Londinium, he has assembled and trained a brand new type of fighting force. His Arts Unit 'Teekazwurtzen' was bestowed upon him by Theresis, the Regent of Kazdel, who also taught him the swordsmanship he now employs.
enemy_1528_manfri.ability: Uses his floating cannon to inflict Arts damage; Upon firing, floating cannon will charge up Londinium Secondary Defense Artillery. [Focus] Continuously gains ASPD when attacking the same target (this effect is capped), rapidly decaying when switching targets or not attacking for a few seconds; [Military Training] Has high Physical and Arts dodge, but after being bombarded by the City Defense Artillery, temporarily loses this dodge effect and is stunned for a few seconds; [From Withered Trunk, New Branches] When defeated for the first time, randomly attacks all targets on the battlefield with his floating cannon, greatly accelerating the charge rate of Londinium Secondary Defense Artillery; In his second form, draws his sword alongside his floating cannon to perform simultaneous Physical and Arts attacks.

enemy_1529_dsdevr.name: The Endspeaker, Will of We Many
enemy_1529_dsdevr.description: The tiny Seaborn that haunted the mighty Stultifera, the blood of its parents once strewn across the ocean's waters. The revelation reaches not the ears of the children, their kind's destiny quietly continuing to flow.
enemy_1529_dsdevr.ability: When defeated, disappears for a short time before evolving into its next form, gaining the following effects in turn: Gains increased DEF/Gains increased Movement Speed/Gains increased ATK and Lifesteal; [Consume] Consumes the Remains of its Seaborn kin, gaining their corresponding Directed Evolution ability in the next evolutionary phase, while also instantly defeating any Operators near the Remains and preventing them from being redeployed for a period of time.

enemy_1530_white.name: Kreide, 'Worldly Remains'
enemy_1530_white.description: Kreide's form, covered in layers of Originium, calls forth only fear in Leithanien. He stopped the Voice of Mundane from consuming others, yet he himself was consumed in turn. He tried to save everyone present, yet there remains only one way to save him.
enemy_1530_white.ability: Attacks deal <@eb.key>splash</> damage. When blocked, attacks inflict <$ba.stun>Stun</>; [The Final Rest] Starts with increased DEF and RES; After being defeated the first time, temporarily changes to an allied unit, then loses the increased DEF and RES, and increases ATK and skill power instead; [Resonance Overload] Causes Realigned Flux to deal continuous damage; [Lamentation of Nothingness] Attacks all targets on the field in order and loses a large amount of HP. When in Realigned Flux, <@eb.key>ASPD is reduced</>

enemy_1531_bbrain.name: 'Awaken'
enemy_1531_bbrain.description: The 'Dreamland' that Dorothy personally created. In here, no one will ever have to suffer the pain of the journey. Love and hope shall achieve that which technology cannot.
enemy_1531_bbrain.ability: Cannot move; Periodically transfers itself to a specified tile and casts [Shattered Vision], dealing a large amount of damage to all units on the field. This damage is split equally among all deployed units; Periodically casts [Journey] towards the left and right, dealing Physical damage to the first unit hit; When 'Awaken' receives damage, transfers 50% of the damage received to Dorothy's other experiments on the field; In its second form, it increases ATK and immediately activates all R-Series Power Armors on the field. [Shattered Vision] will also <$ba.stun>Stun</> units on high ground and [Journey] will be cast in all 4 directions.

enemy_1532_minima.name: 'Materialist Antagonizer'
enemy_1532_minima.description: Construction machinery attempting to protect Stitch Canvas, under the mistaken impression that he is about to be attacked. Before explaining what's actually going on, let's settle things with a test of strength first.
enemy_1532_minima.ability: While on the battlefield, increases the strength of all [Machina] enemies; attacks will deploy small drones that deal continuous Arts damage to the target for a period of time, prioritizing targets that are not already locked onto by these drones; periodically refreshes a shield that can resist Physical and Arts damage, and grants <$ba.invisible>Invisibility</> to other enemies within attack range as long as this shield holds; periodically locks on to the friendly unit with the <@eb.key>greatest number of units around it</> and continuously deals Arts damage in an area around that unit; periodically locks on to the friendly unit with the <@eb.key>fewest number of units around it</> and continuously inflicts <$ba.stun>Stun</> in an area around that unit; when HP drops to 0, Stitch will appear and be <$ba.stun>Stunned</> for a period of time

enemy_1533_stmkgt.name: 'The Last Steam Knight'
enemy_1533_stmkgt.description: Steam Knights are the pride of Victoria, her fist, her highest military honor. The last Steam Knight rises from sealed ruins, intent on defending the Victoria in his heart.
enemy_1533_stmkgt.ability: ATK and Movement Speed are reduced at the start, and restored once [Pneumatic Pressurization] is triggered. [Pneumatic Pressurization]: ATK and Movement Speed increased, becomes immune to control, becomes stunned when expired. [Furious Defense] Charges up before attacking, dealing heavy damage 3 times. [Unto My Last Breath] Leaps into the air after losing a certain amount of HP, targeting your unit with <@eb.key>the highest max HP</>, dealing Arts damage multiple times to the nearby unit with <@eb.key>the highest HP percentage</>. In 2nd form, DEF and RES are reduced, [Pneumatic Pressurization] is permanently active, and [Unto My Last Breath] locks onto an additional target.

enemy_1535_wlfmster.name: Zaaro, Signore dei Lupi
enemy_1535_wlfmster.description: Il Signore dei Lupi was born in the wilderness, but he has cast his gaze upon the world of men. His hubris is boundless, yet he falls short. His tricks exhausted, he has lost everything. Now, someone must be made to bear his wrath.
enemy_1535_wlfmster.ability: Gradually increases <@eb.key>'Blood Debt'</> over time; Damage Reduction; [Hemolytic Horror] Causes 3 friendly units to be consumed by fear, greatly reducing their ASPD, significantly accelerating their periodic HP loss, and causing them to be unable to be retreated manually; Affected units will return to normal after 'Signore dei Lupi' takes a certain percentage of damage; After the first form reaches 0 HP, gains [Primal Deterrence], causing nearby friendly units to have reduced ASPD, and slowly gains HP over time. In the second form, no longer has Damage Reduction, can now be stunned, and no longer casts [Hemolytic Horror]. Attacks instead turn into a long-ranged double strike with increased ATK. Periodically releases a [Furious Howl], causing <@eb.key>'Blood Debt'</> to increase rapidly

enemy_1536_ncrmcr.name: 'The Leader'
enemy_1536_ncrmcr.description: Dublinn's 'Leader,' the life-burning Draco, the fear-evoking shadow. Do not let her close in on you.
enemy_1536_ncrmcr.ability: [Rebirth] While on the field, some enemies will turn into 'Embers' upon defeat and continue fighting; [Sovereign] Casts <@eb.key>Exhausted Flame</> on a target, making them unable to attack or use skills, and dealing Arts damage and <$ba.dt.burning>Burn Damage</> to all friendly units in a cross shape when <@eb.key>Exhausted Flame</> expires or the target retreats; [Give and Take] Sacrifices up to 5 'Flamechaser Soldiers' and gains a temporary Physical/Arts shield proportional to own max HP. In second form, ATK increases, all Reeds on the field instantly ignite, melee attacks deal damage proportional to own double ATK, and ranged attacks and [Sovereign] can choose an additional target

enemy_1538_ymmons.name: 'Ya'
enemy_1538_ymmons.description: The executor of the Feranmut, 'Ya.' According to the Sui Regulators' ancient scrolls, one of the Feranmuts hunted by the Yan a thousand years ago, with the mystical ability to 'cut away the seasons and hold them at Its bosom.' Its wounds still refuse to close, and It laps at them in fury and bewilderment... It returns once more to familiar Yan soil.
enemy_1538_ymmons.ability: Applies 'Winter's Void' on tiles It travels over, [Winter's Void] Continuously summons enemies; [Spring's Birth] Summons a Mirage when blocked. Mirage gains <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</> and applies [Winter's Void] on tiles it travels over. If not defeated after some time, 'Ya' teleports to its location. When Its HP reaches 0 in its first form, attains [Autumn's Bounty], [Slice the Seasons], [Worldly Self], attacks change to ranged with increased Attack Range, and gains <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>. [Autumn's Bounty] Summons a Delusion that has similar abilities to 'Ya' and also applies 'Winter's Void' on tiles it travels over. When 'Ya' is defeated, the Delusion also dies; if the Delusion dies, 'Ya' loses a percentage of Its max HP; [Slice the Seasons] 'Ya' and Delusion deal AoE damage, then switch places and routes; [Worldly Self] 'Ya' and Delusion deal AoE damage to surrounding units.

enemy_1537_mhrors.name: Rathalos
enemy_1537_mhrors.description: The crimson-carapaced, flame-commanding Rathalos, its capacity for flight excels among Flying Wyverns, its aerial assaults and flaming breath combine to dominate over a vast array of life. Owing to the astonishing strength by which it rules the air, it is also known as the 'King of the Skies.'
enemy_1537_mhrors.ability: The Rathalos's <@eb.key>tail</> can be <@eb.key>severed</> by attacking it from behind in its Grounded State; <@eb.key>Flash Grenades</> can knock the Rathalos out of its Flying State; if it is not defeated in the first wave, it will [Nest] and move into the stage's [Den] wave

enemy_1539_reid.name: 'Hateful Avenger'
enemy_1539_reid.description: A Reunion squad leader you've previously faced, who attacks with an impressive searing blade. The formidable foe you defeated in the Area 59 Ruins appears before you once again, unsheathing the flames of vengeance.
enemy_1539_reid.ability: Gains greatly increased ATK when below half HP; [Charge] Locks onto a target within range on the path ahead, and gains greatly increased Movement Speed for a period time; After being defeated for the first time, revives with half HP.

enemy_2003_rockman.name: Lost Colossus
enemy_2003_rockman.description: An experimental creation of a certain caster from the Spires of Leithanien. This colossus was originally made to be a servant, but the old Spire caster forgot to tell it who to serve…
enemy_2003_rockman.ability: Drains 2 Objective HP when entering the Objective Point; Can throw a rock that inflicts a very long <$ba.stun>Stun</> (will not target a unit that is already <$ba.stun>Stunned</>).

enemy_2004_balloon.name: Jetman
enemy_2004_balloon.description: One of the dessert-time jokes among Columbians involves a strange man who calls himself a 'Master Thief,' puttering around with a self-made jetpack. The most valuable thing he's stolen is a single burdenbeast. However, the fact that he made his own jetpack might mean that he really is a master.
enemy_2004_balloon.ability: Drains 5 Objective HP when entering the Objective Point; When blocked, this unit will take off for a period of time (this effect has a cooldown period).

enemy_2005_axetro.name: 'Forsaken One'
enemy_2005_axetro.description: 'The rescuers found a security guard who had been heavily corroded by Originium... already turned into a terrifying monster... carnage everywhere... countless casualties... whereabouts unknown.' —Rim Billiton mining record
enemy_2005_axetro.ability: Drains 5 Objective HP when entering the Objective Point; Continuous attacks will increase ATK and ASPD, up to a limit. This effect will reset after a few seconds after this unit stops attacking.

enemy_2006_flsnip.name: Rusthammer Warrior
enemy_2006_flsnip.description: 'Rusthammer' is a violent organization that has broken away from civilization to wander the wastelands. In these barren wastes, far from the comforts offered by nomadic city-states, life itself is an endless war.
enemy_2006_flsnip.ability: Drains 30 Objective HP when entering the Objective Point; Cannot be blocked, and is Invulnerable for a period of time after entering the battle; Periodically releases a special bolt that deals massive Arts damage.

enemy_2007_flwitch.name: 'Frozen Monstrosity'
enemy_2007_flwitch.description: A Sami snowpriest went to the endless tundra to defend against the demons that invaded her homeland. In the end, she went insane and became a part of the tundra's curse.
enemy_2007_flwitch.ability: Drains 30 Objective HP when entering the Objective Point; Normal attacks and Ice Novas deal Arts damage and inflict the <$ba.cold>Cold</> status; If a target is defeated or retreats while <$ba.frozen>Frozen</>, its Redeployment Time is doubled; Can activate Originium Ice Crystals around the battlefield.

enemy_2008_flking.name: 'Gravestone'
enemy_2008_flking.description: A cruel murderer, an assassin that pursues you relentlessly. The violence bred in this land will eventually grow inside every perpetrator.
enemy_2008_flking.ability: Drains 30 Objective HP when entering the Objective Point; Halves the ATK and DEF of all your units on the battlefield; Halves natural DP regeneration rate; Doubles Redeployment Time; Periodically gains a shield proportional to Max HP.

enemy_2013_csbot.name: Wandering Puppet
enemy_2013_csbot.description: A musical puppet maintained by the Crimson Troupe's prop department. All who have heard its bewitching melodies have turned as one towards the Crimson Troupe, and were never seen again.
enemy_2013_csbot.ability: Drains 5 Objective HP when entering the Objective Point; When not blocked, continuously deals Arts damage to all allied units.

enemy_2014_csicer.name: 'Snow Doe'
enemy_2014_csicer.description: An actor playing the role of the Sami Snowpriest's bodyguard, 'Snow Doe'. After countless performances, they have fallen completely into their role, and wish for their demise at the hands of a foe as twisted as the 'Frozen Monstrosity'.
enemy_2014_csicer.ability: Drains 3 Objective HP when entering the Objective Point; Attacks inflict <$ba.cold>Cold</> to the target; When 'Frost Buck' dies, greatly increases ASPD and Movement Speed, and inherits its ability.

enemy_2015_csicem.name: 'Frost Buck'
enemy_2015_csicem.description: An actor playing the role of the Sami Snowpriest's bodyguard, 'Frost Buck'. After countless performances, they have fallen completely into their role, and wish for their demise at the hands of a foe as scary as the 'Demons'.
enemy_2015_csicem.ability: Drains 3 Objective HP when entering the Objective Point; Attack power greatly increases when attacking <$ba.frozen>Frozen</> targets; When 'Snow Doe' dies, greatly increases ASPD and Movement Speed, and inherits its ability.

enemy_2016_csphtm.name: Lucian, 'Blood Diamond'
enemy_2016_csphtm.description: Calamity of the Crimson Troupe, codename Phantom. Once the rising star of the troupe, the unfinished masterpiece of the troupe leader. Even after his fallout with the troupe and subsequent descent into insanity, he still keeps the name 'Blood Diamond'.
enemy_2016_csphtm.ability: Drains 30 Objective HP when entering the Objective Point; Has a chance to dodge Physical and Arts attacks when not blocked. When blocked, swiftly moves behind the target and leaves an [Ominous Apparition] at the original location; Uses skills to deal Physical damage to the surrounding area; Attacks and skills ignore a certain amount of armor and inflict <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>.

enemy_2018_csdoll.name: Big Sad Lock
enemy_2018_csdoll.description: One of the works of the troupe's host, it isn't very well received amongst the troupe. They do not recognize the stiff manipulation of a puppet as a kind of art, and its rough approach to things is constantly criticized by other members.
enemy_2018_csdoll.ability: Drains 30 Objective HP when a long time has passed in the battle; Attacks two targets at once; Has high endurance and powerful recovery abilities, and enemies continuously appear when on the field; Periodically casts a shield to protect itself. It does not attack when the shield is present, however all enemies' Movement Speed will increase and additional enemies will appear; After receiving a certain number of hits, deals Arts damage to all allied units.

enemy_2019_cshost.name: 'Troupe Mouthpiece'
enemy_2019_cshost.description: The host of the Grand Drama, its mind is completely taken up by its dazzling Arts. The moment it abandoned the Witch King, its curse was deeply etched into the betrayer's spirit. Even so, who cares?
enemy_2019_cshost.ability: Drains 30 Objective HP when entering the Objective Point; Attacks two targets at once and inflicts <$ba.dt.neural>Nervous Impairment</>; Permanently invulnerable; Controls ['Host's Assistants'] in combat. ['Host's Assistant'] reduces the ATK of nearby allied units and continuously deals True damage to them; Loses HP whenever a ['Host's Assistant'] is killed.

enemy_2020_cswrtr.name: 'Playwright'
enemy_2020_cswrtr.description: A nameless youth toiling behind the scenes, he has never stopped writing, even when he lacks pen and paper. Someone here is worthy of his interest, and he doesn't seem hostile.
enemy_2020_cswrtr.ability: Drains 30 Objective HP when entering the Objective Point; Attacks deal damage to the target and all allies in the 4 adjacent tiles. Periodically attacks all allied units on the field; Periodically uses Arts to greatly reduce an allied unit's ASPD and deal Arts damage every second. If Operators under this effect leave the field, the tile they are on will be permanently sealed and cannot be deployed on; When HP falls below 50%, greatly increases DEF, RES and skill casting speed

enemy_2026_syudg.name: Saint Carmen
enemy_2026_syudg.description: The last surviving Saint of Iberia, living well past mortal life expectancy. His longevity came at a price, but he remembers his duty and his enemies, despite having lost his reason.
enemy_2026_syudg.ability: Drains 5 Life Points when entering objective point. When carrying ammo, attacks are ranged and deal heavy Physical damage. Max ammo: <@eb.key>3</>; if reloading is interrupted, becomes <$ba.stun>stunned</> for an additional period.

enemy_2027_syudg2.name: Saint Iberia
enemy_2027_syudg2.description: The last surviving Saint of Iberia, living well past mortal life expectancy. His longevity came at a price, but he will hunt Iberia's enemies for as long as the flame of his life still burns.
enemy_2027_syudg2.ability: Drains 5 Life Points when entering objective point; Increased HP and ATK. Max ammo: <@eb.key>1</>;

enemy_2028_syevil.name: Tidelinked Bishop
enemy_2028_syevil.description: A bishop that has partially mutated. It is partly human, partly—
enemy_2028_syevil.ability: Drains 5 Life Points when entering objective point. When its 'Other Half' is alive and not in coma, enters a coma when HP reaches 0 and begins regenerating; revives when HP reaches max.

enemy_2029_symon.name: Tidelinked Archon
enemy_2029_symon.description: —Sea Terror. Even Ægir technology has a role to play in the evolution of we many.
enemy_2029_symon.ability: Drains 5 Life Points when entering objective point. Attacks inflict additional <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</>. When its 'Other Half' is alive and not in coma, enters a coma when HP reaches 0 and begins regenerating; revives when HP reaches max.

enemy_2030_symon2.name: Tidelinked Immortal
enemy_2030_symon2.description: —Sea Terror. The product of both technology and evolutionary instincts.
enemy_2030_symon2.ability: Drains 5 Life Points when entering objective point. Reduced HP and ATK, increased ASPD and Movement Speed, and increased regeneration when in coma.

enemy_2031_syboy.name: Pathshaper
enemy_2031_syboy.description: Seaborn tasked with exploring evolutionary pathways, its fractals mapping out dead ends so that we many can stay on the right path.
enemy_2031_syboy.ability: Drains 5 Life Points when entering objective point. Every 3rd attack summons a [Pathshaper Fractal]. Summons a [Pathshaper Fractal] after taking a number of attacks.

enemy_2032_syboy2.name: Lingering Pathshaper
enemy_2032_syboy2.description: Seaborn tasked with exploring evolutionary pathways. Its injuries and those suffered by its fractals become a guide for the evolution of we many.
enemy_2032_syboy2.ability: Drains 5 Life Points when entering objective point. HP greatly increased. Summons a [Pathshaper Fractal] after taking a small number of attacks.

enemy_2037_sygirl.name: 'Paranoia Illusion'
enemy_2037_sygirl.description: An Ægir girl who went out of control after ingesting Seaborn cells. Her throat makes no voice, for the prayers of we many have blocked it. She is drowned in power, becoming what she once detested the most.
enemy_2037_sygirl.ability: Drains 30 Life Points when entering objective point. <$ba.float>Low-Altitude Hovering</>. Your units in attack range have greatly reduced ASPD. Attacks 3 targets at the same time, inflicting additional <$ba.dt.erosion>Corrosion Damage</>. Can attack a target multiple times if the number of targets is less than maximum. In 2nd form, attack range is increased, ASPD reduction is increased, and can attack up to 5 targets.

enemy_2038_sydonq.name: The Last Knight
enemy_2038_sydonq.description: The basis of a well-known folk tale in Kazimierz. The past died on the land, and neither the present nor the future have any meaning. Only the ocean; kill the ocean.
enemy_2038_sydonq.ability: Drains 30 Life Points when entering objective point. When damaged, inflict <$ba.cold>cold</> on the source. Effect increased if HP is below 50%. Increased ATK when attacking targets with <$ba.frozen>frozen</>. Unblockable if charging.

enemy_2039_syskad.name: Ishar'mla, Heart of Corruption
enemy_2039_syskad.description: She sings no more. It speaks for we many.
enemy_2039_syskad.ability: Drains 30 Life Points when entering objective point. Normal attacks heal 3 other enemies. Periodically summons [Ishar'mla's Tears] to charge itself. Transforms once fully charged, attacking 3 targets at the same time and dealing True damage. When HP drops below 50%, gain greatly increased ATK, and summon 2 additional [Ishar'mla's Tears].

enemy_2036_syshop.name: Cannot
enemy_2036_syshop.description: A mysterious trader who roams the barrenlands, selling anything that exists in civilization.
enemy_2036_syshop.ability: Cannot attack. Does not deplete Life Points when it disappears. Periodically releases random chemicals that affect the battlefield.

enemy_6001_trsgst.name: Fleet-footed Thief
enemy_6001_trsgst.description: A nimble hand and a quick getaway. Over time, he made a name for himself as the 'Fleet-footed.' Alas, he always ends up stealing more than he can handle and getting caught.
enemy_6001_trsgst.ability: <@eb.key>Cannot be blocked</>; When defeated, grants an additional reward; Does not deplete Life Points seals when spared

enemy_6002_trswlf.name: Teary Detective
enemy_6002_trswlf.description: A low-profile Perro private detective. He takes on all kinds of investigations, never questioning his clients' identities and always sticking to the rules of the job. However, if he happens to get caught, he's not above trading valuable intel in exchange for his freedom.
enemy_6002_trswlf.ability: After receiving damage, gains a layer of <@eb.key>Protection</> (reduces Physical and Arts damage taken) that lasts for several seconds and can stack up to <@eb.key>3</> times; When blocked, can quickly move behind the unit; When defeated, grants an additional reward; Does not deplete Life Points seals when spared

enemy_6003_trsslm.name: 'Shiny Pooloo'
enemy_6003_trsslm.description: A native Originium Slug species with vibrant colors. Wild specimens are extremely timid and will emit light to deter predators when escaping. With training, they can light up in a rhythm and are very popular with women and children.
enemy_6003_trsslm.ability: After attacking 3 times, the next attack <@eb.key><$ba.stun>Stuns</></> the target (prioritizes units that are not Stunned); When defeated, grants an additional reward; Does not deplete Life Points seals when spared

enemy_6004_pleslm.name: 'Milan'
enemy_6004_pleslm.description: A domestic Originium Slug that escaped into the wild before mutating in a high-pressure environment. Despite its tremendous size and sturdy crystal back, it is not aggressive and extremely good at 'interacting' with people. It still views them the same way it did when it was merely a house pet, but what was once playful is now truly destructive at its new size.
enemy_6004_pleslm.ability: When HP falls below 50%, greatly increases ATK and reduces Physical and Arts damage taken; Adds a <@eb.key>Contaminated Mineral</> to the Deployment Waiting Zone (maximum of one); Adds a <@eb.key>Heat Cluster</> to the Preparation Area (When transferred, deals True damage to all allied units and <@eb.key><$ba.stun>Stuns</></> them for several seconds)

enemy_6005_llstone.name: Spherical Colossus
enemy_6005_llstone.description: An Originium Arts construct made from mining waste, originally created to maximize the value of the mines. However, this colossus seems to have realized its own origins, and refused to take part in any mining activities before finally turning against the very people who created it. It has raided many mines, and people fearfully call it the 'Mine Killing Mine.'
enemy_6005_llstone.ability: Deals a small amount of Arts damage to nearby units; Applies a <@eb.key>Crude Sphere</> to the operator with the highest ATK on the field; Randomly applies a <@eb.key>Crude Sphere</> to an operator in the Deployment Waiting Zone

enemy_6006_fystone.name: Crude Sphere
enemy_6006_fystone.description: Part of the Spherical Colossus, it has no sentience but is very heavy. Don't let it latch on to an Operator.
enemy_6006_fystone.ability: Latches onto an operator and gradually loses HP; Prevents the operator from taking action or using skills

enemy_6007_mtslm.name: 'Drifting Cabin'
enemy_6007_mtslm.description: This massive fluorescent Originium slug carries an enormous number of larvae in the interstices along its massive mantle, making it travel extremely slowly. This type of Originium slug lives deep underground all year round, so it's impossible to guess why it has appeared here. Though not hostile, it has devoured a large quantity of discarded ores and grown massive in size, significantly interfering with the cleanup process.
enemy_6007_mtslm.ability: Splits into <@eb.key>5 <Fluorescent Originium Slugs> when defeated</>; periodically adds 'Fluorescent Spores' to the <@eb.key>Deployment Waiting Zone</>, and if there is no space, they will be instead added to the <@eb.key>Recuperation Area</>

enemy_6008_mtslms.name: Fluorescent Originium Slug
enemy_6008_mtslms.description: A native, soft-shelled Originium slug. It has enormous reproductive capacity, and the fluorescence on its shell is a visible pheromone. After molting, it will grow drastically in size over a short period of time

enemy_6009_nlkgtbs.name: 'Fruit of Gluttony'
enemy_6009_nlkgtbs.description: Giant Gloompincer with tentacle-shaped mouthparts, increasing its feeding efficiency. It indiscriminately devours the materials left on the industrial platform, and the resulting chemical reactions in its internal organs have turned the cleanup operation into a putrid nightmare.
enemy_6009_nlkgtbs.ability: Can release 1 type of industrial material when danger level increases. Reduce damage taken, but damage reduction does not work on units blocking it. Gains a shield equal to a percentage of current max HP when HP drops below 25% for the first time.

enemy_6010_boxing.name: 'Boy Wonder' Sandel
enemy_6010_boxing.description: An old underground boxer from Rim Billiton, nicknamed from his debut fight as a youth, where he defeated an older champion hungry for competition. Many years later, he lost to someone even younger than him, and left for the wilderness in anger. Relying on his cunning and life experiences over the years, he became a boxing fixer in the wilderness, and even had the beautiful dream of snatching some land in a nomadic city to build a underground boxing arena, but he had no idea that the key to success or failure was never in his hands to begin with.
enemy_6010_boxing.ability: Takes less damage from all units other than the blocker when blocked, gets knocked down to rest when health drops to a certain percentage; when all HP is restored, gets up again and ASPD increases.

enemy_6011_planty.name: 'Nature's Compromise'
enemy_6011_planty.description: A newly discovered life form and the largest Originium Slug and flower symbiote on reliable record. Capable of boosting plant growth and Originium Slug reproduction by dispersing its pollen, it can even fly slowly in the air. Some scholars believe that its ability to fly is new evidence of unintelligent organisms actively manipulating complex Originium Arts, while others believe it is nothing more than a naturally occurring phenomenon under hyper-specific conditions. This question has yet to be resolved, as no biologist has been desperate enough to approach it.
enemy_6011_planty.ability: Consumes lifeforce while flying over ground tiles and causes vegetation to grow on tiles it travels over; falls to the ground when HP reaches half; [Growth Hormone] While flying, covers surrounding tiles with vegetation, from which Small Symbionts are summoned; [Deciduous Hormone] When Operators are transferred, attacks the Operator on the field with the highest DEF and places a [Modified Phytohormone] into the Deployment Waiting Zone

enemy_6012_plants.name: Small Symbiont
enemy_6012_plants.description: A symbiont that appears alongside 'Nature's Compromise.' It is difficult to distinguish whether they are biological descendants or Originium Slugs contaminated and assimilated by the pollen. Perhaps a combination of both?

enemy_7001_blwzad.name: Tribal Shaman
enemy_7001_blwzad.description: An apprentice caster who has learned some of the ancient Arts of their tribe. Although not yet proficient with Arts, it is enough to fight whoever they disagree with.
enemy_7001_blwzad.ability: Attacks cause the target to receive 50% of this unit's ATK as Arts damage per second over a few seconds (stacks)

enemy_7001_blwzad_2.name: Lord Ameer Shaman
enemy_7001_blwzad_2.description: An elite caster under a Lord Ameer, able to employ a kind of ancient Arts to cast menacing attacks, nicknamed a 'curse' by the locals.
enemy_7001_blwzad_2.ability: Attacks cause the target to receive 50% of this unit's ATK as Arts damage per second over a few seconds (stacks)

enemy_7002_veingd.name: Vein Guardian
enemy_7002_veingd.description: A deformed Infected Creature often found wandering around ore veins, stubbornly thinking they have a duty to guard the mine.
enemy_7002_veingd.ability: More likely to be attacked by friendly units; when attacked, inflicts 200 Arts damage to the attacker

enemy_7002_veingd_2.name: Maddened Vein Guardian
enemy_7002_veingd_2.description: A deformed Infected Creature often found wandering around ore veins. Guarding the mines has become an obsession of theirs, and they are willing to die for it.
enemy_7002_veingd_2.ability: More likely to be attacked by friendly units; when attacked, inflicts 200 Arts damage to the attacker

enemy_7003_catapt.name: 'Anything Can Be Broken'
enemy_7003_catapt.description: A contraption that hurls fruit with rock-hard shells instead of boulders, destroying all constructs in its detection range by targeting their weak points. The designer must surely have been an expert in architecture.
enemy_7003_catapt.ability: Prioritizes attacking constructs; when attacking constructs, ATK increases to 150%

enemy_7003_catapt_2.name: 'Everything Should Be Smashed'
enemy_7003_catapt_2.description: A contraption that hurls fruit with rock-hard shells instead of boulders, destroying all constructs in its detection range by targeting their weak points. After some improvements and upgrades, it is powerful enough to destroy large constructs.
enemy_7003_catapt_2.ability: Prioritizes attacking constructs; when attacking constructs, ATK increases to 180%

enemy_7004_xbdeer.name: Leporibeast Shorthorn
enemy_7004_xbdeer.description: A herbivorous beast commonly found almost anywhere in the wild. It has small but sharp horns and is not aggressive, but will run and jump to avoid attacks when frightened. The meat is very tender.
enemy_7004_xbdeer.ability: Does not attack; after being attacked, runs away a random distance and rests for a period of time

enemy_7004_xbdeer_2.name: Leporibeast Longhorn
enemy_7004_xbdeer_2.description: A herbivorous beast commonly found almost anywhere in the wild. It has grown large horns, but will still run away on reflex, jumping even higher and faster. The meat is very tender.
enemy_7004_xbdeer_2.ability: Does not attack; after being attacked, runs away a random distance and rests for a period of time

enemy_7005_xbbull.name: Mossback Beast
enemy_7005_xbbull.description: A beast with moss growing on its back, appearing round and gentle but it is actually fierce with a terrible temper. The moss on its body has a hemostatic effect, and it will eat it when injured.
enemy_7005_xbbull.ability: Normally does not attack, but will counter when attacked. Gradually restores HP over time

enemy_7005_xbbull_2.name: Lush Mossback Beast
enemy_7005_xbbull_2.description: A beast with moss all over its body, easily agitated compared to others of its kind because of tiny, hard-to-remove bugs hiding in its vegetation. The moss grows back extremely quickly, and it will sometimes eat some even when uninjured.
enemy_7005_xbbull_2.ability: Normally does not attack, but will counter when attacked. Gradually restores HP over time

enemy_7006_xbcrab.name: Cragpincer
enemy_7006_xbcrab.description: A crab-like creature with rocks on its shell that it uses to camouflage itself. Extremely tenacious, it can sometimes be found far from sources of water. A distant relative of Metal Crabs, but its meat is delicious.
enemy_7006_xbcrab.ability: Normally does not attack, but counters when attacked

enemy_7006_xbcrab_2.name: Crystalline Cragpincer
enemy_7006_xbcrab_2.description: A Cragpincer with crystals on its shell, not only eye-catching but also extremely beautiful. However, it is also harder to handle. The completely crystallized carapace is a popular ornament once properly processed. It is said that some people also keep these as ornamental pets.
enemy_7006_xbcrab_2.ability: Normally does not attack, but counters when attacked

enemy_7015_xbcrab2.name: 'Consortium of Pincers'
enemy_7015_xbcrab2.description: A Cragpincer with a gigantic crystallized shell, its back broad enough to carry two average-sized cragpincers. If it can withstand the weight of two cragpincers and the crystals on its back, who knows how strong it actually is, so do be careful of its pincers!
enemy_7015_xbcrab2.ability: Normally does not attack, but counters when attacked

enemy_7007_xbbird.name: Sandfall Crystalhoof
enemy_7007_xbbird.description: An extremely rare and exquisite beast. It feeds on rhizomes, giving its coat a dense but fine light golden luster. When on the move, it's almost as if golden sand was falling from its body, so it is highly sought by collectors and artists. However, it is extremely nimble and difficult to capture, but is the secret ingredient spoken of in legends... do you really want to hunt it?
enemy_7007_xbbird.ability: Does not attack; after being attacked, runs away a random distance and rests for a period of time. Moves through different areas

enemy_7008_wrkwrk.name: Basic Harvester
enemy_7008_wrkwrk.description: Basic mechanical workers capable of gathering and transporting resources. Their capacity is not very large but they are industrious and diligent.
enemy_7008_wrkwrk.ability: Automatically locates and attacks Ore Veins, returning spoils to the Harvester Hub

enemy_7009_mtmoun.name: 'The Immortal'
enemy_7009_mtmoun.description: A warrior of unknown background who wears exquisite but tattered armor. He strides forward, sand cupped within his hands, no longer responsive to anyone.
enemy_7009_mtmoun.ability: Normally does not attack, but counters when attacked. Recovers a percentage of its own HP when a friendly unit is retreated or defeated within range

enemy_7010_bldrgn.name: Great Wingbeast
enemy_7010_bldrgn.description: An extremely silent Great Wingbeast. This Infected creature has a pair of crystallized wings bigger than its body, but cannot fly too high or for too long. A ferocious carnivore, but this one seems to have had its meal, and is merely curious about the tiny things that have appeared before it.
enemy_7010_bldrgn.ability: Normally does not attack, but counters when attacked. Can turn into an aerial unit for a period of time and deal ranged splash Arts damage, and also inflicts <$ba.dt.burning>Burn Damage</>

enemy_7011_paki.name: Sargonian Contract Assassin
enemy_7011_paki.description: A Sargonian assassin available for hire. Extremely agile with their unusual footwork. If the pay is generous enough, they are also willing to take on non-assassination work at their own discretion, and charge by the hour.
enemy_7011_paki.ability: Invisible; blinks forward a short distance when blocked

enemy_7012_wilder.name: Dauntless Linebreaker
enemy_7012_wilder.description: The advance linebreaker officer under the command of a Sargonian Lord Ameer. He cares for nothing but removing all obstacles in his way, fearing neither life nor death. He is the strongest and bravest soldier in the entire army.
enemy_7012_wilder.ability: Damage taken is greatly reduced when not blocked; Gains greatly increased ATK, ASPD, and Movement Speed in second form

enemy_7013_slwazd.name: 'The Ruinbringer'
enemy_7013_slwazd.description: An elite Caster honored by the local Lord Ameer, capable of manipulating Infected creatures to fight. Destroying their enemies is merely a side effect of the ultimate destruction that they wish to see.
enemy_7013_slwazd.ability: Less likely to be attacked; Summons 2 Infused Originium Slugs for assistance; summons 2 Infused Originium Slugs and 2 Infused Originium Slugs α in second form

enemy_7014_dva.name: 'Al-Rafiq'
enemy_7014_dva.description: Elite armored corps of a Lord Ameer operating their self-assembled armor. Its self-destruct system is the only part they are unsatisfied with, and it is obvious they care more about their beloved machine than the Lord Ameer's orders.
enemy_7014_dva.ability: Can only be blocked by units with 2 Block or higher; after attacking 3 times, the next attack deals massive physical splash damage; when defeated in mech form, its pilot jumps out to repair the mech, dealing physical damage to and stunning nearby friendly units for a few seconds. In its second form, the pilot does not attack nor move, becomes Invisible, and reflects physical damage while repairing the mech. After some time, they return to the mech and it returns to its first form.
